original: sa'i khams gang yin pa de ni bdag yin la /
analyzed: sa'i khams gang yin pa de ni bdag yin la /
translated: The earth element is the self.

original: bdag gang yin pa de ni sa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gang yin pa de ni sa yin te /
translated: The self is the earth element.

original: de ltar sa dang bdag gnyis su dbyer med cing tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar sa dang bdag gnyis su dbyer med cing tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, earth and self are inseparable and not different.🔽The self of the self is complete.

original: bdag gi bdag ni rdzogs pa yin no zhes nas de dag sa la bkur stir byed /
analyzed: bdag gi bdag ni rdzogs pa yin no zhes nas de dag sa la bkur stir byed /
translated: They honor the earth,

original: btsun par byed /🔽ri mor byed /🔽mchod par byed do //
analyzed: btsun par byed / ri mor byed / mchod par byed do //
translated: revere it,🔽and make offerings to it.

original: de dag gis bkur stir byas /
analyzed: de dag gis bkur stir byas /
translated: They honor it,

original: btsun par byas /🔽ri mor byas so //
analyzed: btsun par byas / ri mor byas so //
translated: revere it,

original: mchod par byas nas /🔽dga' zhing mgu la yi rangs te /
analyzed: mchod par byas nas / dga' zhing mgu la yi rangs te /
translated: and make offerings to it.🔽Having done so, they are delighted, pleased, and overjoyed.

original: bkur stir byed cing nye bar brten te /
analyzed: bkur stir byed cing nye bar brten te /
translated: They honor it and rely on it.

original: gnas la sems kyis lung bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas la sems kyis lung bstan pa yin no //
translated: They mentally proclaim the earth to be the teacher.

original: sems can chu dang me dang rlung la bdag tu 'du shes pa dag kyang yod de /🔽rlung gang yin pa de ni bdag yin la /
analyzed: sems can chu dang me dang rlung la bdag tu 'du shes pa dag kyang yod de / rlung gang yin pa de ni bdag yin la /
translated: There are also beings who perceive water, fire, and wind as the self.🔽Wind is the self.

original: bdag gang yin pa de ni rlung yin te /
analyzed: bdag gang yin pa de ni rlung yin te /
translated: The self is wind.

original: de ltar rlung dang bdag gnyis su dbyer med cing tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rlung dang bdag gnyis su dbyer med cing tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, wind and self are inseparable and not different.

original: bdag gis bdag ni rdzogs pa yin no zhes nas de dag rlung las bkur stir byed /🔽btsun par byed /
analyzed: bdag gis bdag ni rdzogs pa yin no zhes nas de dag rlung las bkur stir byed / btsun par byed /
translated: They will say, We have perfected ourselves. They will honor the wind.🔽They will revere it,

original: ri mor byed /
analyzed: ri mor byed /
translated: respect it,

original: mchod par byed do //🔽de dag gis bkur stir byas /🔽btsun par byas /🔽ri mor byas /
analyzed: mchod par byed do // de dag gis bkur stir byas / btsun par byas / ri mor byas /
translated: and worship it.

original: mchod par byas nas dga' zhing mgu la yi rangs te /
analyzed: mchod par byas nas dga' zhing mgu la yi rangs te /
translated: Having honored it, revered it, respected it, and worshipped it, they will be happy, delighted, and joyful.

original: bkur stir byed cing nye bar brten te gnas la sems kyis lung bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bkur stir byed cing nye bar brten te gnas la sems kyis lung bstan pa yin no //
translated: They will honor it and rely on it, but they will not receive a prophecy of their future enlightenment.

original: sems can sa la nam mkhar 'du shes pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sems can sa la nam mkhar 'du shes pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are sentient beings who perceive the earth as space, and space as the earth.

original: sa la nam mkhar 'du shes pa ji ltar bu zhe na //
analyzed: sa la nam mkhar 'du shes pa ji ltar bu zhe na //
translated: How is it that they perceive the earth as space, and space as the earth?

original: sa la nam mkhar 'du shes pa ji ltar bu zhe na /🔽til rmed pa'i mi la la zhig gis khron pa brko ba'i mi 'ga' zhig la 'di skad du /
analyzed: sa la nam mkhar 'du shes pa ji ltar bu zhe na / til rmed pa'i mi la la zhig gis khron pa brko ba'i mi 'ga' zhig la 'di skad du /
translated: How is it that they perceive the earth as space, and space as the earth?

original: kye sdong po me reg ma dang 'dra @45b ba'i mi glang mthong ngam zhes smras so //🔽des smras pa /
analyzed: kye sdong po me reg ma dang 'dra @45b ba'i mi glang mthong ngam zhes smras so // des smras pa /
translated: A man who is eating sesame seeds will ask a man digging a well, Hey, have you seen an elephant like a burnt stump?

original: ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: ma mthong ngo //
translated: The other man will say, I haven't seen one.

original: til za 'am mi za /
analyzed: til za 'am mi za /
translated: The first man will ask, Have you eaten sesame seeds?

original: smras pa mi za'o zhes so //
analyzed: smras pa mi za'o zhes so //
translated: The other man will say, I haven't eaten any.

original: de ltar na sa la nam mkhar 'du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sa la nam mkhar 'du shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the idea of earth in regard to space.

original: ji ltar na nam mkha' la sar 'du shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nam mkha' la sar 'du shes she na /
translated: How is it the idea of earth in regard to space?🔽It is like a certain Brahmin who, having gone by donkey cart,🔽got down from the donkey cart,

original: smras pa / ji ltar bram ze la la zhig bong bu'i shing rtas song nas bong bu'i shing rta las babs te /🔽bong bu'i shing rta phur bu la btags nas phur bu nam mkha' la btab te /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar bram ze la la zhig bong bu'i shing rtas song nas bong bu'i shing rta las babs te / bong bu'i shing rta phur bu la btags nas phur bu nam mkha' la btab te /
translated: tied the donkey to a peg,

original: btsugs nas mgo la bas dkris te /
analyzed: btsugs nas mgo la bas dkris te /
translated: and, having covered his head with a cloth,🔽lay down on the ground.

original: sa la gan rkyal du nyal ba de bzhin du nam mkha' la sang 'du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: sa la gan rkyal du nyal ba de bzhin du nam mkha' la sang 'du shes pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is the idea of earth in regard to space.

original: lo gcig la dus gcig tu mtshan mo ni yud tsam bco brgyad /
analyzed: lo gcig la dus gcig tu mtshan mo ni yud tsam bco brgyad /
translated: In one year, there is one day and one night of eighteen muhūrtas for the gods of the Four Great Kings.

original: nyin mo ni yud tsam bcu gnyis yod do //
analyzed: nyin mo ni yud tsam bcu gnyis yod do //
translated: In one year, there is one day and one night of twelve muhūrtas for humans of Jambudvīpa.

original: lo gcig la dus gcig tu mtshan mo ni yud tsam bco brgyad /
analyzed: lo gcig la dus gcig tu mtshan mo ni yud tsam bco brgyad /
translated: In one year, there is one day and one night of eighteen muhūrtas for the gods of the Four Great Kings.🔽In one year, there is one day and one night of twelve muhūrtas for humans of Jambudvīpa.

original: nyin mo ni yud tsam bcu gnyis pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyin mo ni yud tsam bcu gnyis pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: dgu na zla tha chungs yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad la mtshan mo ni yud tsam bco brgyad /
analyzed: dgu na zla tha chungs yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad la mtshan mo ni yud tsam bco brgyad /
translated: In the ninth month, on the fifteenth day of the waxing moon, the night is eighteen muhūrtas long.

original: nyin mo ni yud tsam bcu gnyis yod do //🔽tshes dgu phan chad ni mtshan mo ni 'bri /
analyzed: nyin mo ni yud tsam bcu gnyis yod do // tshes dgu phan chad ni mtshan mo ni 'bri /
translated: The day has twelve muhūrtas.

original: nyin mo ni skye ste /🔽mtshan mo ni thang cig re res 'bri'o //
analyzed: nyin mo ni skye ste / mtshan mo ni thang cig re res 'bri'o //
translated: From the ninth day of the waxing moon, the night decreases and the day increases.

original: nyin mo ni thang cig re res skye'o //🔽lo gcig la dus gcig tu nyin mo ni yud tsam bco brgyad /
analyzed: nyin mo ni thang cig re res skye'o // lo gcig la dus gcig tu nyin mo ni yud tsam bco brgyad /
translated: The night decreases by one muhūrtta each day and the day increases by one muhūrtta each day.

original: mtshan mo ni yud tsam bcu gnyis yod de /🔽lo gcig la dus gcig tu nyin mo ni yud tsam bco brgyad /
analyzed: mtshan mo ni yud tsam bcu gnyis yod de / lo gcig la dus gcig tu nyin mo ni yud tsam bco brgyad /
translated: In one year, there are two times when the day has eighteen muhūrtas and the night has twelve muhūrtas.

original: mtshan mo ni yud tsam bcu gnyis pa de gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / ston zla ba yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad la nyin mo ni yud tsam bco brgyad /
analyzed: mtshan mo ni yud tsam bcu gnyis pa de gang zhe na / smras pa / ston zla ba yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad la nyin mo ni yud tsam bco brgyad /
translated: What are these two times?

original: mtshan mo ni yud tsam bcu gnyis yod do //🔽tshes dgu pan chad ni nyin mo 'bri /
analyzed: mtshan mo ni yud tsam bcu gnyis yod do // tshes dgu pan chad ni nyin mo 'bri /
translated: On the eighth day of the waxing moon of the autumn, the day has eighteen muhūrtas and the night has twelve muhūrtas.

original: mtshan mo ni skye ste /🔽nyin mo ni thang cig re res 'bri'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo ni skye ste / nyin mo ni thang cig re res 'bri'o //
translated: From the ninth day of the waxing moon, the day decreases and the night increases.

original: mtshan mo ni thang cig re res skye'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo ni thang cig re res skye'o //
translated: The day decreases by one muhūrtta each day and the night increases by one muhūrtta each day.

original: lo gcig la dus gnyis su mtshan mo yang yud tsam bco lnga /
analyzed: lo gcig la dus gnyis su mtshan mo yang yud tsam bco lnga /
translated: In one year, there are two times when the night has fifteen muhūrtas and the day has fifteen muhūrtas.

original: nyin mo la yang yud tsam bco lnga pa yod de /🔽lo gcig la dus gnyis su mtshan mo yang yud tsam bco lnga /
analyzed: nyin mo la yang yud tsam bco lnga pa yod de / lo gcig la dus gnyis su mtshan mo yang yud tsam bco lnga /
translated: There are also fifteen muhūrtas in a day.🔽In a year, there are two times fifteen muhūrtas of night and fifteen muhūrtas of day.

original: nyin mo yang yud tsam bco lnga pa de dag gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / dpyid zla tha chungs yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad dang ston zla tha chungs yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad la mtshan mo yang yud tsam bco lnga /
analyzed: nyin mo yang yud tsam bco lnga pa de dag gang zhe na / smras pa / dpyid zla tha chungs yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad dang ston zla tha chungs yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad la mtshan mo yang yud tsam bco lnga /
translated: What are they?🔽It is said:

original: nyin mo yang yud tsam bco lnga yod do //
analyzed: nyin mo yang yud tsam bco lnga yod do //
translated: On the eighth day of the waxing moon of the last month of spring and on the eighth day of the waxing moon of the last month of autumn, there are fifteen muhūrtas of night and fifteen muhūrtas of day.

original: chos bzhi yod de /
analyzed: chos bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four dharmas:

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: skad cig dang / de'i skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam rnams so //
analyzed: skad cig dang / de'i skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam rnams so //
translated: They are a moment, a moment of that, a second, and a muhūrta.

original: skad cig brgya @46a * //
analyzed: skad cig brgya @46a * //
translated: One hundred moments

original: nyi shu la ni de'i skad cig go //
analyzed: nyi shu la ni de'i skad cig go //
translated: is one moment of that.

original: de'i skad cig drug cu la ni thang cig go //🔽thang cig sum cu la ni yud tsam cig go //🔽yud tsam sum cu la ni nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: de'i skad cig drug cu la ni thang cig go // thang cig sum cu la ni yud tsam cig go // yud tsam sum cu la ni nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: Sixty moments of that is one second.🔽Thirty seconds is one muhūrta.🔽Thirty muhūrtas is one day and night.

original: nyin zhag sum cu'i cha gcig ni yud tsam gcig go //
analyzed: nyin zhag sum cu'i cha gcig ni yud tsam gcig go //
translated: One-thirtieth of a day and night is one muhūrta.

original: yud tsam gyi sum cu cha gcig ni thang cig go //
analyzed: yud tsam gyi sum cu cha gcig ni thang cig go //
translated: One thirtieth of a moment is an instant.

original: thang cig gi drug cu cha gcig ni de'i skad cig go //
analyzed: thang cig gi drug cu cha gcig ni de'i skad cig go //
translated: One sixtieth of an instant is a second.

original: de'i skad cig gi brgya nyi shu'i cha gcig gi skad cig go //
analyzed: de'i skad cig gi brgya nyi shu'i cha gcig gi skad cig go //
translated: One hundred and twentieth of a second is a minute.

original: skad cig gi tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig gi tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of a minute?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bud med bal 'khal ba 'bring gis ha cang mi ring ha cang mi thung bar bal bsnyad pa de tsam gyi yun ni skad cig gi tshad yin no //
analyzed: bud med bal 'khal ba 'bring gis ha cang mi ring ha cang mi thung bar bal bsnyad pa de tsam gyi yun ni skad cig gi tshad yin no //
translated: The time it takes for a strong woman to snap her fingers is a minute.

original: de lta bu'i skad cig brgya nyi shu la de'i skad cig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i skad cig brgya nyi shu la de'i skad cig go //
translated: Twenty of those is a second.

original: de'i skad cig de lta bu drug cu la thang cig go //🔽thang cig de lta bu sum cu la yud tsam gcig go //
analyzed: de'i skad cig de lta bu drug cu la thang cig go // thang cig de lta bu sum cu la yud tsam gcig go //
translated: Sixty of those is an instant.🔽Thirty of those is a moment.

original: yud tsam de lta bu sum cu la nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: yud tsam de lta bu sum cu la nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: Thirty of those is a day and night.

original: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig go //
analyzed: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig go //
translated: Thirty of those is a month.

original: zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig go //
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig go //
translated: Twelve of those is a year.

original: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs bcu pa'o /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs bcu pa'o /
translated: This is the tenth chapter on the arrangement of the world.

original: // / gleng gzhi ni yul mnyan du yod pa ste /
analyzed: // / gleng gzhi ni yul mnyan du yod pa ste /
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
translated: The Bhagavān has said,

original: bskal pa ni grangs med pa bzhi ste /🔽grangs med pa dag gis bskal pa 'jig go //
analyzed: bskal pa ni grangs med pa bzhi ste / grangs med pa dag gis bskal pa 'jig go //
translated: “There are four incalculables.🔽Incalculables pass with the destruction of the world.

original: grangs med pa dag gis bskal pa zhig par gnas so //
analyzed: grangs med pa dag gis bskal pa zhig par gnas so //
translated: Incalculables pass with the world remaining in destruction.

original: grangs med pa dag gis 'chags so //
analyzed: grangs med pa dag gis 'chags so //
translated: Incalculables pass with the formation of the world.

original: grangs med pa dag gis bskal pa 'chags par gnas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: grangs med pa dag gis bskal pa 'chags par gnas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Incalculables pass with the world remaining in formation.”

original: bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cu la ni bskal pa chen po gcig ste /
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cu la ni bskal pa chen po gcig ste /
translated: Eighty intermediate eons make one great eon.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shus ni 'jig rten 'jig go //🔽bar gyi bskal pa nyi shus ni 'jig rten zhig par gnas so //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shus ni 'jig rten 'jig go // bar gyi bskal pa nyi shus ni 'jig rten zhig par gnas so //
translated: Twenty intermediate eons pass with the destruction of the world.🔽Twenty intermediate eons pass with the world remaining in destruction.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shus ni 'jig rten 'chags so //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shus ni 'jig rten 'chags so //
translated: Twenty intermediate eons pass with the formation of the world.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shus ni 'jig rten 'chags par gnas so //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shus ni 'jig rten 'chags par gnas so //
translated: Twenty intermediate eons pass with the world remaining in formation.

original: 'jig pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Destruction is of three types:

original: mes 'jig pa dang / chus 'jig pa dang / rlung gis 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: mes 'jig pa dang / chus 'jig pa dang / rlung gis 'jig pa'o //
translated: destruction by fire, destruction by water, and destruction by wind.

original: 'jig pa gsum gyi rtse mo ni 'od gsal ba dang / dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams te /
analyzed: 'jig pa gsum gyi rtse mo ni 'od gsal ba dang / dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams te /
translated: The peak of the three destructions is the Abhasvara gods, the Subhakṛtsna gods, and the Vrhatphala gods.

original: gang gi tshe mes 'jig pa 'byung ba de'i tshe 'od gsal gyi lha rnams la 'jig pa'i rtse mo thug go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mes 'jig pa 'byung ba de'i tshe 'od gsal gyi lha rnams la 'jig pa'i rtse mo thug go //
translated: When the destruction by fire occurs, the Abhasvara gods are the peak of the destruction.

original: gang gi tshe chus 'jig pa 'byung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chus 'jig pa 'byung ba de'i tshe /
translated: When the destruction by water occurs,

original: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams la 'jig pa'i rtse @46b mo thug go //
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams la 'jig pa'i rtse @46b mo thug go //
translated: the Subhakṛtsna gods are the peak of the destruction.

original: gang gi tshe rlung gis 'jig pa 'byung ba de'i tshe 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams la 'jig pa'i rtse mo thug go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rlung gis 'jig pa 'byung ba de'i tshe 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams la 'jig pa'i rtse mo thug go //
translated: When the destruction by wind occurs, the Vrhatphala gods are the peak of the destruction.

original: mes 'jig pa lan bdun zhing chus 'jig pa lan gcig /
analyzed: mes 'jig pa lan bdun zhing chus 'jig pa lan gcig /
translated: Seven destructions by fire occur, then one destruction by water.

original: chus 'jig pa lan bdun zhing rlung gis 'jig pa lan bdun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chus 'jig pa lan bdun zhing rlung gis 'jig pa lan bdun 'byung ngo //
translated: Seven destructions by water occur, then seven destructions by wind occur.

original: bar gyi bskal pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three intermediate eons:

original: mtshon gyi bar gyi bskal pa dang / nad kyi bar gyi bskal pa dang / mu ge'i bar gyi bskal pa ste /
analyzed: mtshon gyi bar gyi bskal pa dang / nad kyi bar gyi bskal pa dang / mu ge'i bar gyi bskal pa ste /
translated: the intermediate eon of weapons, the intermediate eon of disease, and the intermediate eon of famine.

original: bskal pa ni mtshon dang nad dang mu ge gsum gyis mtha' thug par 'gyur ro //🔽gang gi tshe mtshon gyi bar gyi bskal pa 'ong du cha zhing 'byung du nye bar gyur pa de'i tshe mi rnams kyi tshe lo bcu thub par gyur te /🔽tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi nang na gang yun ring du 'tsho ba des lo bcu thub ste dper na da ltar gyi mi rnams kyi nang na gang yun ring du 'tsho zhing ci legs ci bder rim gro byed pa des lo brgya 'am /
analyzed: bskal pa ni mtshon dang nad dang mu ge gsum gyis mtha' thug par 'gyur ro // gang gi tshe mtshon gyi bar gyi bskal pa 'ong du cha zhing 'byung du nye bar gyur pa de'i tshe mi rnams kyi tshe lo bcu thub par gyur te / tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi nang na gang yun ring du 'tsho ba des lo bcu thub ste dper na da ltar gyi mi rnams kyi nang na gang yun ring du 'tsho zhing ci legs ci bder rim gro byed pa des lo brgya 'am /
translated: The eon ends with three calamities:🔽When the eon of the sword is about to begin, the life expectancy decreases to ten years.🔽In the period when the life expectancy is ten years, the humans who live the longest live for ten years.

original: cung zad lhag par thub pa de bzhin du tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi nang na yang yun ring du 'tsho ba des lo bcu thub po //
analyzed: cung zad lhag par thub pa de bzhin du tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi nang na yang yun ring du 'tsho ba des lo bcu thub po //
translated: Just as today, humans who live the longest live one hundred years or a little more, in the same way, in the period when the life expectancy is ten years, the humans who live the longest live for ten years.

original: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi bu gcig pa sdug cing yid du 'ong ba la mas legs su smon pa na bdag gi bu lo bcu pa'i bar du yun ring du 'tsho bar gyur cig ces legs su smon par byed de /🔽dper na da ltar gyi mi rnams kyi bu gcig pa sdug cing yid du 'ong ba la mas legs su smon pa na 'di skad du /
analyzed: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi bu gcig pa sdug cing yid du 'ong ba la mas legs su smon pa na bdag gi bu lo bcu pa'i bar du yun ring du 'tsho bar gyur cig ces legs su smon par byed de / dper na da ltar gyi mi rnams kyi bu gcig pa sdug cing yid du 'ong ba la mas legs su smon pa na 'di skad du /
translated: When the mothers of the children of those people whose lifespan is ten years make good wishes for their beloved and only children, they make good wishes saying, “May my child live a long time, up to ten years.”

original: bdag gi bu lo brgya'i bar du yun ring du 'tsho bar gyur cig ces legs su smon par byed pa de bzhin du /🔽tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi bu gcig pa sdug cing yid du 'ong ba la mas legs su smon pa na 'di skad du /
analyzed: bdag gi bu lo brgya'i bar du yun ring du 'tsho bar gyur cig ces legs su smon par byed pa de bzhin du / tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi bu gcig pa sdug cing yid du 'ong ba la mas legs su smon pa na 'di skad du /
translated: For example, when the mothers of the children of people of today make good wishes for their beloved and only children, they make good wishes saying, “May my child live a long time, up to one hundred years.”

original: bdag gi bu lo bcu pa'i bar du yun ring du 'tsho bar gyur cig ces legs su smon par byed do //
analyzed: bdag gi bu lo bcu pa'i bar du yun ring du 'tsho bar gyur cig ces legs su smon par byed do //

analyzed: tshe lo brgyad khri ba'i mi rnams kyi bu mo btsas nas lo lnga brgya lon na khyim thab la gtong ngo //
translated: In the same way, when the girls of the people with an eighty-thousand-year lifespan reach the age of five hundred, they will be given in marriage.

original: tshe lo brgyad khri ba'i mi rnams kyi nang ni rnam pa gsum yod de 'dod pa dang / zas mi za ba dang / rga ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: tshe lo brgyad khri ba'i mi rnams kyi nang ni rnam pa gsum yod de 'dod pa dang / zas mi za ba dang / rga ba rnams yin no //
translated: The humans of the period of the first Asamkhyeya lived 80,000 years.

original: tshe lo brgyad khri ba'i mi @50b rnams kyi 'bru rnams ni che zhing mchog tu che ste /
analyzed: tshe lo brgyad khri ba'i mi @50b rnams kyi 'bru rnams ni che zhing mchog tu che ste /
translated: The grains of this period were large:

original: dper na aindra be nu'i 'bras bu bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na aindra be nu'i 'bras bu bzhin te /
translated: they were like the fruit of the Indravajra.

original: rgyal zhing mchog tu rgyal la snye ma gcig pu las kyang bre bo bzhi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyal zhing mchog tu rgyal la snye ma gcig pu las kyang bre bo bzhi 'byung ngo //
translated: One harvest was sufficient to assure the subsistence of four persons.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mu khyud brtan lung bstan pa las 'di skad du /🔽dge slong dag mi rnams ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos 'di dag nyid yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir tshe lo bcu par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mu khyud brtan lung bstan pa las 'di skad du / dge slong dag mi rnams ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos 'di dag nyid yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir tshe lo bcu par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Blessed One has declared in the Vyākṣaṇā

original: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi nang na gang yun ring du 'tsho ba des lo bcu thub ste snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi nang na gang yun ring du 'tsho ba des lo bcu thub ste snga ma bzhin du /
translated: that the humans of the period of the decrease of life, when life is ten years in length,🔽will be like the fruits of the Jambū tree, that is, they will be of two types:

original: tshe lo brgyad khri thub pa'i mi rnams ni 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid na 'byor pa dang rgyas pa dang bde ba dang lo legs par 'gyur zhing skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ngo //
analyzed: tshe lo brgyad khri thub pa'i mi rnams ni 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid na 'byor pa dang rgyas pa dang bde ba dang lo legs par 'gyur zhing skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ngo //
translated: The people who live 80,000 years are prosperous, flourishing, happy, and well-fed in this Jambudvīpa, and it is full of many people and living beings.

original: tshe lo brgyad khri ba'i mi rnams kyi grong dang grong rdal dang yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor rnams kyi bar bya gag 'phur bas slebs pa tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe lo brgyad khri ba'i mi rnams kyi grong dang grong rdal dang yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor rnams kyi bar bya gag 'phur bas slebs pa tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The villages, towns, countries, and royal cities of the people who live 80,000 years are so close that a crow could fly from one end of Jambudvīpa to the other in a day.

original: tshe lo brgyad khri ba'i mi rnams kyi bu mo btsas nas lo lnga brgya lon pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshe lo brgyad khri ba'i mi rnams kyi bu mo btsas nas lo lnga brgya lon pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The girls of the people who live 80,000 years are married at 500 years of age.

original: tshe lo brgyad khri ba'i mi rnams kyi nad rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: tshe lo brgyad khri ba'i mi rnams kyi nad rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The people who live 80,000 years have three kinds of illnesses:

original: 'dod pa dang / zas mi za ba dang / rga ba rnams yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / zas mi za ba dang / rga ba rnams yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: desire, fasting, and old age.

original: gang gi tshe nad kyi bar gyi bskal pa 'ong du cha zhing 'byung du nye bar gyur pa de'i tshe mi rnams kyi tshe lo bcu thub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nad kyi bar gyi bskal pa 'ong du cha zhing 'byung du nye bar gyur pa de'i tshe mi rnams kyi tshe lo bcu thub par 'gyur te /
translated: When the intermediate eon of sickness is about to appear, the life expectancy of humans is ten years.

original: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi nang na gang yun ring du 'tsho ba des lo bcu thub ste /
analyzed: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi nang na gang yun ring du 'tsho ba des lo bcu thub ste /
translated: Among humans with a life expectancy of ten years, those who live a long time live for ten years.🔽The verse of the sutra should be quoted in full:🔽Those who live a long time have ten years,🔽girls are married at five,

original: rgyas par ring du gang 'tsho ba dang bu mo dang // gos dang zas dang nub par 'gyur ba dang // rgyan rnams dang ni bkur dang sdang ba dang // zhes mdo'i tshigs su bcad pa smos par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ring du gang 'tsho ba dang bu mo dang // gos dang zas dang nub par 'gyur ba dang // rgyan rnams dang ni bkur dang sdang ba dang // zhes mdo'i tshigs su bcad pa smos par bya'o //
translated: and food is destroyed by weapons.

original: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams chos ma yin pa spyod cing mi rigs par byed do //
analyzed: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams chos ma yin pa spyod cing mi rigs par byed do //
translated: Humans with a life expectancy of ten years practice non-Dharma and do what is improper.

original: de dag chos ma yin pa spyod cing mi rigs pa byed pas mi ma yin pa rnams 'khrugs nas nad dang / gnod pa dang / nad 'go ba rnams gtong ste /
analyzed: de dag chos ma yin pa spyod cing mi rigs pa byed pas mi ma yin pa rnams 'khrugs nas nad dang / gnod pa dang / nad 'go ba rnams gtong ste /
translated: Because they practice non-Dharma and do what is improper, non-humans become angry and send down sickness, harm, and epidemics.

original: der 'di lta ste mi mang po nad kyis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der 'di lta ste mi mang po nad kyis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: There, many humans die from sickness.

original: de'i tshe gang su yang rung ste shi ba de dag thams cad lus dang bral nas sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gang su yang rung ste shi ba de dag thams cad lus dang bral nas sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, whoever dies will be reborn in hell.

original: nad kyi bar gyi bskal pa de yang zla ba bdun dang nyin zhag bdun kho nar zad de /
analyzed: nad kyi bar gyi bskal pa de yang zla ba bdun dang nyin zhag bdun kho nar zad de /
translated: The intermediate eon of disease will end after seven months and seven days.

original: zla ba bdun dang nyin zhag bdun gyis mthar thug par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba bdun dang nyin zhag bdun gyis mthar thug par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The intermediate eon of famine will end after seven years, seven months, and seven days.

original: de nas mi de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag chos ma yin par spyod cing @51a * //
analyzed: de nas mi de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag chos ma yin par spyod cing @51a * //
translated: Then the people will think, “Because of our unrighteous conduct,

original: mi rigs par byed pa 'di dang / sdug bsngal la zhugs pa 'dis gnyen 'dun zad cing nor zad la longs spyod zad par gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi rigs par byed pa 'di dang / sdug bsngal la zhugs pa 'dis gnyen 'dun zad cing nor zad la longs spyod zad par gyur gyi /
translated: we have experienced this misfortune, and our relatives, wealth, and possessions have been exhausted.

original: bdag cag gis dge ba'i chos 'ga' zhig yang dag par blangs te 'khod par bya na /
analyzed: bdag cag gis dge ba'i chos 'ga' zhig yang dag par blangs te 'khod par bya na /
translated: Let us now practice some wholesome conduct.

original: dge ba'i chos gang zhig yang dag par blangs te 'khod par bya snyam du sems so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos gang zhig yang dag par blangs te 'khod par bya snyam du sems so //
translated: What wholesome conduct should we practice?”

original: de dag 'di snyam du kye bdag cag ni srog gcod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag 'di snyam du kye bdag cag ni srog gcod pa yin gyi /
translated: They will think, “We have killed living beings.

original: bdag cag gis srog gcod pa spong bar bya'o zhes nas de dag srog gcod pa spong ngo //
analyzed: bdag cag gis srog gcod pa spong bar bya'o zhes nas de dag srog gcod pa spong ngo //
translated: We will abstain from killing. And they do abstain from killing.🔽The children and grandchildren of those who abstain from killing when the human life span is ten years will live to be twenty years old.

original: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi srog gcod pa spang ba de dag gi bu dang bu mo btsas pa rnams tshe lo nyi shu thub par gyur pa nas rgyas par tshe lo brgyad khri ba'i mi rnams 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid na 'byor pa dang / rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi srog gcod pa spang ba de dag gi bu dang bu mo btsas pa rnams tshe lo nyi shu thub par gyur pa nas rgyas par tshe lo brgyad khri ba'i mi rnams 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid na 'byor pa dang / rgyas pa dang /
translated: In this way, the human life span will gradually increase up to eighty thousand years.🔽At that time, this Jambudvipa will be prosperous, flourishing, peaceful, well-supplied with food, and full of many people and animals.

original: bde ba dang lo legs par 'gyur zhing skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba dang / bu mo lo lnga brgya lon pa'i bar du snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bde ba dang lo legs par 'gyur zhing skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba dang / bu mo lo lnga brgya lon pa'i bar du snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The women will be engaged as before up to five hundred years of age.

original: nad rnam pa gsum yod pa nas 'bru rnams che zhing mchog tu che ste /
analyzed: nad rnam pa gsum yod pa nas 'bru rnams che zhing mchog tu che ste /
translated: There will be three kinds of illnesses, and the grains will be large and of the highest quality.

original: dper na aindra be nu'i 'bras bu bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na aindra be nu'i 'bras bu bzhin te /
translated: For example, they will be like the indra fruit.

original: rgyal zhing mchog tu rgyal la snye ma gcig pu las kyang bre bo bzhi 'byung ba'i bar du rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal zhing mchog tu rgyal la snye ma gcig pu las kyang bre bo bzhi 'byung ba'i bar du rgyas par bya'o //
translated: The king will be victorious and of the highest victory, and even from a single ear of corn, four bushels will emerge.

original: gang gi tshe mu ge'i bar gyi bskal pa 'ong du cha zhing 'byung du nye bar gyur pa de'i tshe mi rnams kyi tshe lo bcu thub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mu ge'i bar gyi bskal pa 'ong du cha zhing 'byung du nye bar gyur pa de'i tshe mi rnams kyi tshe lo bcu thub par 'gyur te /
translated: When the period of famine is about to occur, the life expectancy of humans is ten years.

original: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi nang na gang yun ring du 'tsho ba des lo bcu thub pa na /
analyzed: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams kyi nang na gang yun ring du 'tsho ba des lo bcu thub pa na /
translated: Among humans with a life expectancy of ten years, those who live a long time live for ten years.

original: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams chos ma yin pa spyod cing mi rigs pa byed pa'i bar du rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe lo bcu pa'i mi rnams chos ma yin pa spyod cing mi rigs pa byed pa'i bar du rgyas par bya'o //
translated: The humans with a life expectancy of ten years practice non-Dharma and do what is improper.

original: de dag chos ma yin pa spyod cing mi rigs par byed pas lhas dus dus su char gyi rgyun legs par mi 'bebs te /
analyzed: de dag chos ma yin pa spyod cing mi rigs par byed pas lhas dus dus su char gyi rgyun legs par mi 'bebs te /
translated: Because they practice non-Dharma and do what is improper, the gods do not rain at the proper time.

original: mu ge dang / tshegs chen po dang / dgon pa dang / thur mas 'tsho ba dang / rjud pa dang / rus pa dkar po 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mu ge dang / tshegs chen po dang / dgon pa dang / thur mas 'tsho ba dang / rjud pa dang / rus pa dkar po 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Famine, great difficulty, wilderness, living by a spoon, emaciation, and white bones appear.

original: mu ge zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe slong ba rnams kyis slong mo rnyed par dka' ste /
analyzed: mu ge zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe slong ba rnams kyis slong mo rnyed par dka' ste /
translated: Famine is when it is difficult for beggars to get alms.

original: de bas na mu ge zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mu ge zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called famine.

original: tshegs chen po zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe mi rnams rtsol ba chen po dang / 'bad pa chen po dang / bsham pa chen po dang / lus gzer ba chen pos zas dang gos sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: tshegs chen po zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe mi rnams rtsol ba chen po dang / 'bad pa chen po dang / bsham pa chen po dang / lus gzer ba chen pos zas dang gos sgrub par byed de /
translated: “Great hardship” means that at that time people would obtain food and clothing through great effort, great exertion, great preparation, and great physical pain.

original: de bas na tshegs chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na tshegs chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “great hardship.”

original: dgon pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de ltar 'brog chen po'i dgon pa dang / chu'i dgon pa dang / chom rkun gyi dgon pa yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dgon pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de ltar 'brog chen po'i dgon pa dang / chu'i dgon pa dang / chom rkun gyi dgon pa yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: “Desert” means that just as there are great deserts, waterless deserts, and bandit deserts,

original: de'i tshe bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / @51b bgo ba'i dgon pa chen po yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / @51b bgo ba'i dgon pa chen po yod de /
translated: at that time there will be great deserts of food, drink, and clothing.

original: de bas na dgon pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dgon pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “desert.”

original: rjud pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi 'gyel ba zhes bya ba yin pa de'i dus na rjud pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rjud pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi 'gyel ba zhes bya ba yin pa de'i dus na rjud pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “Emaciation” means that what is now called “collapse” was then called “emaciation.”

original: de'i tshe mi de dag bkres pa dang / nyam chung ba dang ldan pas sa la 'gyel to //
analyzed: de'i tshe mi de dag bkres pa dang / nyam chung ba dang ldan pas sa la 'gyel to //
translated: At that time, people, being afflicted by hunger and weakness, would collapse on the ground.

original: 'gyel nas kyang ldang mi nus so //
analyzed: 'gyel nas kyang ldang mi nus so //
translated: Having collapsed, they would be unable to rise up.

original: gzhan yang su yang slong nus pa med pa de dag de nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang su yang slong nus pa med pa de dag de nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And those who are unable to beg will die right there.

original: rjud pa des mi de shi bas na ming rjud pa rjud pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: rjud pa des mi de shi bas na ming rjud pa rjud pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: Because of that famine, that man died, and so the name of that famine was “the famine of exhaustion.”

original: gzhan yang rjud pa'i ming ni gab tse ba la yang bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rjud pa'i ming ni gab tse ba la yang bya ste /
translated: “Famine” is also called “the famine of the pot.”

original: de'i tshe mi de dag gis 'bru sna tshogs dang / 'bras rnams gab tse'i nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi de dag gis 'bru sna tshogs dang / 'bras rnams gab tse'i nang du bcug ste /
translated: At that time, people put various grains and rice into a pot,🔽thinking, “This will be the grain seed for future generations.”

original: 'di skye bo phyi ma rnams kyi 'bru'i sa bon du bya'o zhes nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skye bo phyi ma rnams kyi 'bru'i sa bon du bya'o zhes nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And so they died.

original: de bas na rjud pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rjud pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is why it is called “the famine of the pot.”

original: thur mas 'tsho ba zhes bya ba de'i tshe na mi rnams kyi sa las sa bon gang skyed pa de dag 'bru chung ba 'am /
analyzed: thur mas 'tsho ba zhes bya ba de'i tshe na mi rnams kyi sa las sa bon gang skyed pa de dag 'bru chung ba 'am /
translated: “The famine of the spoon” is when the seeds of the crops that people plant in the fields produce small grains🔽or only one grain of rice.

original: 'bras bu gcig pu 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang tshe thung ba'i mi rnams bza' mi rim gyis thur ma 'dri ma ste de ring ni jo bos gsol gyi sang ni jo mos gsol lo //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pu 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang tshe thung ba'i mi rnams bza' mi rim gyis thur ma 'dri ma ste de ring ni jo bos gsol gyi sang ni jo mos gsol lo //
translated: And so the people, who have short lives, gradually eat with a spoon. “Today the master eats, tomorrow the mistress eats.”

original: de ring ni jo cos gsol gyi sang ni jo co lcam gsol lo zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de'i tshe mi rnams 'bras kyi bang ba dang / 'bru'i bang ba dag nas 'bru sna tshogs kyi 'bru thur mas brus te /
analyzed: de ring ni jo cos gsol gyi sang ni jo co lcam gsol lo zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de'i tshe mi rnams 'bras kyi bang ba dang / 'bru'i bang ba dag nas 'bru sna tshogs kyi 'bru thur mas brus te /
translated: Moreover, at that time people would take various grains from their grain stores and rice stores with a ladle,

original: chu mang po dang rdza ma'i nang du blugs nas bskol te /
analyzed: chu mang po dang rdza ma'i nang du blugs nas bskol te /
translated: put them in a pot with much water, and boil them.

original: 'thung bas de'i phyir thur mas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'thung bas de'i phyir thur mas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They drank this, and for this reason it was called “living by a ladle.”🔽White bones: at that time people died from hunger and weakness, and their bones were rough and not oily.

original: rus pa dkar po zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe mi rnams bkres shing nyam chung ba dang ldan bzhin du 'chi ba de dag gi rus pa de dag rtsub cing snum bag med pa dang / gzhan yang de'i tshe mi rnams kyis rus pa de dag bsdus te /
analyzed: rus pa dkar po zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe mi rnams bkres shing nyam chung ba dang ldan bzhin du 'chi ba de dag gi rus pa de dag rtsub cing snum bag med pa dang / gzhan yang de'i tshe mi rnams kyis rus pa de dag bsdus te /
translated: Moreover, at that time people collected those bones,

original: chu mang po dang rdza ma'i nang du blugs nas rus pa'i khu ba bskol te 'thung bas de'i phyir rus pa dkar po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chu mang po dang rdza ma'i nang du blugs nas rus pa'i khu ba bskol te 'thung bas de'i phyir rus pa dkar po zhes bya'o //
translated: put them in a pot with much water, boiled the bone broth, and drank it. For this reason it was called “white bones.”

original: de dag la sogs pa rnam grangs mang po rnams brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa rnam grangs mang po rnams brjod par bya'o //
translated: These and other such enumerations should be expressed.

original: de'i tshe mu ge chen po'i bar gyi bskal pa de de lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mu ge chen po'i bar gyi bskal pa de de lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, the intermediate eon of famine will be like this.

original: de'i tshe gang su yang rung ste shi ba de dag thams cad yi dags su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gang su yang rung ste shi ba de dag thams cad yi dags su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, whoever dies will all be reborn as hungry ghosts.

original: mu ge'i bar gyi bskal pa de yang lo bdun dang / zla ba bdun dang / nyin zhag bdun kho nar zad de /
analyzed: mu ge'i bar gyi bskal pa de yang lo bdun dang / zla ba bdun dang / nyin zhag bdun kho nar zad de /
translated: The intermediate eon of famine will end in just seven years, seven months, and seven days.

original: lo bdun dang / zla ba bdun dang nyin zhag bdun 'das nas mthar thug par brjod par bya'o //🔽der mi gang mu ge'i @52a * //
analyzed: lo bdun dang / zla ba bdun dang nyin zhag bdun 'das nas mthar thug par brjod par bya'o // der mi gang mu ge'i @52a * //
translated: After seven years, seven months, and seven days have passed, it will be said to have ended.

original: bar gyi bskal pas 'dog cing 'dzem par gyur la smod cing rnam par smod pa de dag las kha cig chu klung chen po dang / mtsho chen po dang / rdzing chen po dag dang / lu ma chen po dag dang / lteng ka dag tu song nas khre rgod dang /
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pas 'dog cing 'dzem par gyur la smod cing rnam par smod pa de dag las kha cig chu klung chen po dang / mtsho chen po dang / rdzing chen po dag dang / lu ma chen po dag dang / lteng ka dag tu song nas khre rgod dang /
translated: At that time, among humans, those who are killed by the intermediate eon of famine, who are frightened and ashamed, who are reviled and disparaged, some will go to great rivers, great lakes, great ponds, great marshes, and pools, and eat the roots of the lotus plants,

original: autpa la'i rtsa ba dag gis 'tsho zhing 'dug ste /
analyzed: autpa la'i rtsa ba dag gis 'tsho zhing 'dug ste /
translated: They will live on the roots of the utpala flower.

original: lo bdun dang / zla ba bdun dang / nyin zhag bdun lon nas grong dang grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dag tu phyir ldog ste /
analyzed: lo bdun dang / zla ba bdun dang / nyin zhag bdun lon nas grong dang grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dag tu phyir ldog ste /
translated: After seven years, seven months, and seven days have passed, they will return to the villages, towns, countries, and capital cities.

original: sems can de dag gcig gis gcig mthong nas shas cher byams pa dang / sdug pa dang / gus pa dang / snying brtse ba'i sems nye bar gnas bar 'gyur te /🔽'di skad du kye ma sems can gson po mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems can de dag gcig gis gcig mthong nas shas cher byams pa dang / sdug pa dang / gus pa dang / snying brtse ba'i sems nye bar gnas bar 'gyur te / 'di skad du kye ma sems can gson po mthong ngo //
translated: When those sentient beings see each other, they will feel a great deal of love, affection, respect, and compassion.🔽They will say, “Oh, look! A living sentient being!”

original: kye ma sems can gson po mthong ngo zhes kyang 'dzer to //
analyzed: kye ma sems can gson po mthong ngo zhes kyang 'dzer to //
translated: “Oh, look! A living sentient being!”

original: kun du bsdus shing kun tu 'thas par byas nas gcig tu 'dus par byas te /
analyzed: kun du bsdus shing kun tu 'thas par byas nas gcig tu 'dus par byas te /
translated: Having gathered and solidified it, they cause it to become one.

original: thur du yang zug par byed cing steng ni chu dang mnyam par 'jog go //🔽de ni nub kyi ba lang @59a * //
analyzed: thur du yang zug par byed cing steng ni chu dang mnyam par 'jog go // de ni nub kyi ba lang @59a * //
translated: It sinks down and the upper part becomes level with the water.

original: spyod ces bya ba'i gling yin te /
analyzed: spyod ces bya ba'i gling yin te /
translated: That is the western continent called Godaniya.

original: dpag tshad brgyad khri ni chu'i 'og gser gyi sa gzhi chen po la brten to //
analyzed: dpag tshad brgyad khri ni chu'i 'og gser gyi sa gzhi chen po la brten to //
translated: It is 80,000 yojanas below the water, resting on the great golden ground.

original: steng ni chu dang mnyam par 'dug ste /
analyzed: steng ni chu dang mnyam par 'dug ste /
translated: The upper part is level with the water.

original: chur dpag tshad nyis stong lnga brgya /
analyzed: chur dpag tshad nyis stong lnga brgya /
translated: The water is 2,500 yojanas deep.

original: zheng du yang dpag tshad nyis stong lnga brgya yod la mtha' skor du dpag tshad bdun stong lnga brgya yod de /
analyzed: zheng du yang dpag tshad nyis stong lnga brgya yod la mtha' skor du dpag tshad bdun stong lnga brgya yod de /
translated: It is 2,500 yojanas wide and 7,500 yojanas in circumference.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa sa las grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa sa las grub pa yin no //
translated: It is well-formed, beautiful to behold, and made of gold.

original: yun ring mo zhig 'das nas chu'i rgya mtsho chen po de'i steng ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi byang phyogs kyi phyi rol gyi rgya mtsho chen por nang du bltas pa dang / phyi rol du bltas pa'i rlung khor khor yug nas gru bzhir ldang ba de'i dus kyang yod la de'i skabs kyang yod do //
analyzed: yun ring mo zhig 'das nas chu'i rgya mtsho chen po de'i steng ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi byang phyogs kyi phyi rol gyi rgya mtsho chen por nang du bltas pa dang / phyi rol du bltas pa'i rlung khor khor yug nas gru bzhir ldang ba de'i dus kyang yod la de'i skabs kyang yod do //
translated: After a long time, on the surface of that great ocean of water, in the great ocean outside the north of Meru, the king of mountains, the wind that blows from the outer ring, looking inward and outward, arises in a square way.

original: de dag gi chu de dag kun du sdud cing kun du 'thas par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi chu de dag kun du sdud cing kun du 'thas par byed do //
translated: That water is gathered and solidified.

original: kun du bsdus shing kun du 'thas par byas nas gcig tu 'dus par byas te /
analyzed: kun du bsdus shing kun du 'thas par byas nas gcig tu 'dus par byas te /
translated: Having gathered and solidified it, it becomes one mass.

original: thur du zug par byed cing steng ni chu dang mnyam par gzhog go //
analyzed: thur du zug par byed cing steng ni chu dang mnyam par gzhog go //
translated: It sinks down and the top becomes level with the water.

original: de ni byang gi sgra mi snyan zhes bya ba'i gling yin te /
analyzed: de ni byang gi sgra mi snyan zhes bya ba'i gling yin te /
translated: This is the northern continent called Kuru.

original: dpag tshad brgyad khri ni chu'i 'og gser gyi sa gzhi chen po la brten to //
analyzed: dpag tshad brgyad khri ni chu'i 'og gser gyi sa gzhi chen po la brten to //
translated: It is 80,000 yojanas below the water and rests on the great golden base.

original: steng ni chu dang mnyam par 'dug ste /
analyzed: steng ni chu dang mnyam par 'dug ste /
translated: It is level with the water.

original: chur dpag tshad nyis stong stong zheng du yang dpag tshad nyis stong yod la /
analyzed: chur dpag tshad nyis stong stong zheng du yang dpag tshad nyis stong yod la /
translated: It is 2,000 yojanas above the water and 2,000 yojanas wide.

original: mtha' skor du dpag tshad brgyad stong yod do //
analyzed: mtha' skor du dpag tshad brgyad stong yod do //
translated: It is 8,000 yojanas in circumference.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa sa las grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa sa las grub pa yin no //
translated: It is well-shaped, beautiful, and pleasant to behold, and is made of earth.

original: yun ring mo zhig 'das nas nam mkha' la tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong par legs par gnas par 'gyur ba de'i dus kyang yod la de'i skabs kyang yod do //
analyzed: yun ring mo zhig 'das nas nam mkha' la tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong par legs par gnas par 'gyur ba de'i dus kyang yod la de'i skabs kyang yod do //
translated: There is a time when, after a long period, the empty Brahma palace appears in the sky and remains there.

original: de nas sems can tshe zad cing las zad la bsod nams zad nas 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris nas tshe 'phos te /
analyzed: de nas sems can tshe zad cing las zad la bsod nams zad nas 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris nas tshe 'phos te /
translated: Then, when the lifespan of sentient beings is exhausted, their karma is exhausted, and their merit is exhausted, they pass away from the class of gods of clear light

original: tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong pa'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong pa'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and are reborn in the empty Brahma palace.

original: de nas sems can gzhan yang tshe zad cing las zad la bsod nams zad nas 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris nas shi 'phos te /
analyzed: de nas sems can gzhan yang tshe zad cing las zad la bsod nams zad nas 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris nas shi 'phos te /
translated: Then, other sentient beings, their life span, karma, and merit exhausted, die and transmigrate from the light gods.

original: tshangs pa'i 'dun na 'don pa'i lhar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'dun na 'don pa'i lhar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, other sentient beings, their life, actions and merit exhausted, die in the Ābhāsvara gods and are reborn in the Brahmā heaven.

original: de nas tshangs pa'i ris su skye'o //
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa'i ris su skye'o //
translated: Then, they are reborn in the Brahmakāyika gods.

original: de nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi bar du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi bar du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, they are reborn in the Caturmahārājika gods.

original: de tsam gyis na 'jig rten ni bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'chags pa de mthar thug par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na 'jig rten ni bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'chags pa de mthar thug par brjod par bya'o //
translated: To this extent, the world is said to have been formed for twenty intermediate kalpas.

original: de nas 'jig rten 'di bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur chags nas gnas pa de yang 'byung bar brjod @59b par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten 'di bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur chags nas gnas pa de yang 'byung bar brjod @59b par bya'o //
translated: Then, after the world has been formed for twenty intermediate kalpas, it remains.

original: yun ring mo zhig 'das nas chu'i rgya mtsho chen po de'i steng du chu'i rgyun shing rta'i srog shing tsam gyi char 'bab pa de'i dus kyang yod la de'i skabs kyang yod do //
analyzed: yun ring mo zhig 'das nas chu'i rgya mtsho chen po de'i steng du chu'i rgyun shing rta'i srog shing tsam gyi char 'bab pa de'i dus kyang yod la de'i skabs kyang yod do //
translated: After a long time, there is a time when a rain falls on the great ocean of water, the size of a chariot axle, and there is a time when this happens.

original: des rol mtsho rnams kyang gang bar byed la gling rnams kyang chu dang mnyam bar gzhog ste /
analyzed: des rol mtsho rnams kyang gang bar byed la gling rnams kyang chu dang mnyam bar gzhog ste /
translated: The water fills the pleasure-lakes and overflows, leveling the continents.

original: sa chen po 'di chu gcig cing rgya mtsho gcig tu 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: sa chen po 'di chu gcig cing rgya mtsho gcig tu 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: The great earth becomes a single body of water, a single ocean.

original: sa chen po chu gcig cing rgya mtsho gcig tu gyur pa'i steng du rlung gis spris ma kun du sdud cing kun du 'thas par byed do //
analyzed: sa chen po chu gcig cing rgya mtsho gcig tu gyur pa'i steng du rlung gis spris ma kun du sdud cing kun du 'thas par byed do //
translated: On the surface of the great earth, which has become a single body of water, a single ocean, the wind gathers the froth and spreads it out.

original: legs par gnas par byed cing kun du bdal te /
analyzed: legs par gnas par byed cing kun du bdal te /
translated: It spreads it out well and makes it even.

original: dper na 'o ma bskol te bsgrangs pa'i steng du rlung gis spris ma kun du sdud cing kun du 'thas par byed de /
analyzed: dper na 'o ma bskol te bsgrangs pa'i steng du rlung gis spris ma kun du sdud cing kun du 'thas par byed de /
translated: For example, when milk is boiled, the wind gathers the froth and spreads it out.🔽It spreads it out well and makes it even.

original: legs par gnas par byed cing kun du bdal ba de bzhin du sa chen po chu gcig cing rgya mtsho gcig tu gyur pa'i steng du rlung gis spris ma kun du sdud cing kun du 'thas par byed de /
analyzed: legs par gnas par byed cing kun du bdal ba de bzhin du sa chen po chu gcig cing rgya mtsho gcig tu gyur pa'i steng du rlung gis spris ma kun du sdud cing kun du 'thas par byed de /
translated: In the same way, on the surface of the great earth, which has become a single body of water, a single ocean, the wind gathers the froth and spreads it out.

original: legs par gnas par byed cing kun du bdal te /
analyzed: legs par gnas par byed cing kun du bdal te /
translated: It spreads it out well and makes it even.

original: de ni sa'i bcud kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa dang / ro phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni sa'i bcud kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa dang / ro phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: It is the essence of the earth, which is of perfect color, perfect smell, and perfect taste.

original: kha dog ni dper na mar sar bzhin no //
analyzed: kha dog ni dper na mar sar bzhin no //
translated: Its color is like that of refined butter.

original: ri ni dper na sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi ma bskol ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ri ni dper na sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi ma bskol ba bzhin no //
translated: Its taste is like that of uncontaminated honey.

original: de nas sems can gzhan tshe zad cing las zad la bsod nams zad pas 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris nas shi 'phos nas 'jig rten 'dir skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sems can gzhan tshe zad cing las zad la bsod nams zad pas 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris nas shi 'phos nas 'jig rten 'dir skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, other sentient beings, whose life-span, actions, and merit are exhausted, die in the Ābhāsvara class of gods and are reborn in this world.

original: de dag 'dir gzugs bzang ba dang yid las skyes pa dang / ma nyams pa dang / dbang po tshang ba dang / yan lag dang nying lag thams cad dang ldan pa dang / bzang ba dang / mdog sdug pa dang / dga' ba'i bza' ba dang dga' ba'i zas dang /
analyzed: de dag 'dir gzugs bzang ba dang yid las skyes pa dang / ma nyams pa dang / dbang po tshang ba dang / yan lag dang nying lag thams cad dang ldan pa dang / bzang ba dang / mdog sdug pa dang / dga' ba'i bza' ba dang dga' ba'i zas dang /
translated: Here, they have a good physical form, are born from the mind, are complete, have all their faculties, have all their major and minor body parts, are beautiful, have a lovely complexion, and have delightful food and drink.

original: rang las 'od 'byung ba dang / nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / tshe ring zhing yun ring por gnas so //
analyzed: rang las 'od 'byung ba dang / nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / tshe ring zhing yun ring por gnas so //
translated: They emit light from their own bodies, move through space, have a long life-span, and live for a long time.

original: de'i tshe na nyi ma dang / zla ba 'di gnyis 'jig rten du mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe na nyi ma dang / zla ba 'di gnyis 'jig rten du mi 'byung ngo //
translated: At that time, neither the sun nor the moon appeared in the world.

original: rgyu skar rnams kyang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu skar rnams kyang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The stars did not appear.

original: dus tshigs dang / lo rnams kyang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dus tshigs dang / lo rnams kyang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The seasons and years did not appear.

original: zla ba dang zla ba phyed rnams mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zla ba dang zla ba phyed rnams mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The months and fortnights did not appear.

original: mtshan mo dang nyin mo rnams mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan mo dang nyin mo rnams mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Night and day did not appear.

original: skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam rnams mi 'byung /
analyzed: skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam rnams mi 'byung /
translated: Seconds, minutes, and hours did not appear.

original: skyes pa dang / bud med kyang med de /
analyzed: skyes pa dang / bud med kyang med de /
translated: There were no men and no women.

original: gzhan du na sems can sems can zhes bya ba'i ming 'ba' zhig 'byung ngo /🔽// /'jig rten gzhag pa /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can sems can zhes bya ba'i ming 'ba' zhig 'byung ngo / // /'jig rten gzhag pa /
translated: There was only the name “sentient being, sentient being.”

original: @60a * // bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: @60a * // bam po bdun pa /
translated: The Establishment of the World

original: de nas sems can bskal pa'i rang bzhin gzhan zhig gis sa'i bcud mdzub mo'i thor tos blangs te myangs so //🔽ji tsam du myong bar byed pa de tsam du sred par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sems can bskal pa'i rang bzhin gzhan zhig gis sa'i bcud mdzub mo'i thor tos blangs te myangs so // ji tsam du myong bar byed pa de tsam du sred par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, a certain sentient being of an eon nature took a pinch of the earth’s essence and tasted it.🔽To the extent that he tasted it, he became desirous.

original: ji tsam du sred par gyur pa de tsam du kham gyis za bar byed do //
analyzed: ji tsam du sred par gyur pa de tsam du kham gyis za bar byed do //
translated: To the extent that he became desirous, he ate it as food.

original: sems can gzhan dag gis kyang sems can de dag sa'i bcud mdzub mo'i thor tos blangs te myong bar byed pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag gis kyang sems can de dag sa'i bcud mdzub mo'i thor tos blangs te myong bar byed pa mthong ngo //
translated: Other sentient beings saw them taking the essence of the earth with their fingers and eating it.

original: mthong nas sems can de dag gis kyang sa'i bcud mdzub mo'i thor tos sa blangs te myong bar byed do //
analyzed: mthong nas sems can de dag gis kyang sa'i bcud mdzub mo'i thor tos sa blangs te myong bar byed do //
translated: Having seen that, those sentient beings also took the essence of the earth with their fingers and ate it.

original: ji tsam du myong bar byed pa de tsam du sred par gyur to //
analyzed: ji tsam du myong bar byed pa de tsam du sred par gyur to //
translated: As much as they ate, so much did they crave.

original: ji tsam du sred par gyur pa de tsam du kham gyis za bar byed do //
analyzed: ji tsam du sred par gyur pa de tsam du kham gyis za bar byed do //
translated: As much as they craved, so much did they eat.

original: sems can de dag gis sa'i bcud kham gyis zos pa des na de dag gi lus la ma khrang ba dang lci ba zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: sems can de dag gis sa'i bcud kham gyis zos pa des na de dag gi lus la ma khrang ba dang lci ba zhugs par gyur to //
translated: Because those sentient beings ate the essence of the earth, their bodies became heavy and coarse.

original: 'od dang kha dog gi mdog gang yin pa de ni med par gyur te /
analyzed: 'od dang kha dog gi mdog gang yin pa de ni med par gyur te /
translated: Whatever radiance and complexion they had disappeared.

original: 'jig rten du mun pa byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'jig rten du mun pa byung bar gyur to //
translated: Darkness appeared in the world.

original: chos nyid kyis na 'jig rten du mun pa byung na nyi ma dang zla ba 'di gnyis 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis na 'jig rten du mun pa byung na nyi ma dang zla ba 'di gnyis 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the nature of things, when darkness appears in the world, the sun and moon appear in the world.

original: rgyu skar rnams dang / mtshan mo dang nyin mo rnams dang / dus tshigs dang lo rnams dang / skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu skar rnams dang / mtshan mo dang nyin mo rnams dang / dus tshigs dang lo rnams dang / skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The stars, the night and day, the seasons and the years, the moments, the seconds and the minutes appear in the world.🔽Then, when the sun rises in the east, the sentient beings say:

original: de nas sems can de dag gi shar phyogs nas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'char ba na de dag 'di skad du lha'i 'od de nyid 'di re /
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag gi shar phyogs nas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'char ba na de dag 'di skad du lha'i 'od de nyid 'di re /
translated: “This is the light of the gods, this is the light of the gods.”

original: lha'i 'od de nyid 'di re zhes nas ming nyin par nyin par zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: lha'i 'od de nyid 'di re zhes nas ming nyin par nyin par zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: And the day is called “the day” because of that.🔽Then, when the sun sets in the west, the sentient beings say:

original: de nas sems can de dag gi nub phyogs su nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor nub pa na de dag 'di skad du lha'i 'od de nyid dmar por gyur pa 'di re /
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag gi nub phyogs su nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor nub pa na de dag 'di skad du lha'i 'od de nyid dmar por gyur pa 'di re /
translated: “This is the light of the gods turning red, this is the light of the gods turning red.”

original: lha'i 'od de nyid dmar por gyur pa 'di re zhes nas mtshan mo mtshan mo zhes bya ba'i grangs su bgrang ngo //
analyzed: lha'i 'od de nyid dmar por gyur pa 'di re zhes nas mtshan mo mtshan mo zhes bya ba'i grangs su bgrang ngo //
translated: And the night is called “the night” because of that.

original: de nas sems can de dag gi shar phyogs nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor shar ba dang sems can 'di skad du mun pa bkra bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag gi shar phyogs nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor shar ba dang sems can 'di skad du mun pa bkra bar byed do //
translated: Then, in the east, a moon disk arose for those sentient beings, and they said, “It illuminates the darkness.

original: mun pa bkra bar byed do zhes nas zla ba zla ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su bgrang ngo //
analyzed: mun pa bkra bar byed do zhes nas zla ba zla ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su bgrang ngo //
translated: It illuminates the darkness.” And so the name “moon” came into existence.

original: de nas sems can de dag gi shar phyogs nas yang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'char ba na /
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag gi shar phyogs nas yang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'char ba na /
translated: Then, in the east, a sun disk arose for those sentient beings.

original: de dag 'di snyam du lha'i 'od de nyid 'khor ba 'di re /
analyzed: de dag 'di snyam du lha'i 'od de nyid 'khor ba 'di re /
translated: They thought, “That light of the gods is the same as this world.

original: lha'i 'od de nyid 'khor ba 'di re zhes nas nyi ma nyi ma zhes bya ba'i ming 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lha'i 'od de nyid 'khor ba 'di re zhes nas nyi ma nyi ma zhes bya ba'i ming 'byung ngo //
translated: That light of the gods is the same as this world.” And so the name “sun” came into existence.

original: de dag bza' ba @60b dang / kha zas de za la /
analyzed: de dag bza' ba @60b dang / kha zas de za la /
translated: They ate that food and drink,

original: tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas so //🔽de dag gi nang na kha zas che sa mang du za ba de ni kha dog ngan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas so // de dag gi nang na kha zas che sa mang du za ba de ni kha dog ngan par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they lived for a long time, for a very long time.🔽Among them, those who ate more of that food had bad complexions,

original: gang kha zas ches nyung du za ba de ni kha dog bzang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang kha zas ches nyung du za ba de ni kha dog bzang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: while those who ate less of that food had good complexions.

original: de ltar kha zas sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis kha dog sna tshogs yod par gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar kha zas sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis kha dog sna tshogs yod par gyur to //
translated: Thus, due to the various kinds of food, there came to be various complexions.

original: kha dog sna tshogs yod par gyur pas /🔽kye sems can nga ni kha dog bzang ba yin no //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs yod par gyur pas / kye sems can nga ni kha dog bzang ba yin no //
translated: And because there were various complexions,🔽some beings came to despise other beings, saying,

original: khyod ni kha dog ngan pa yin no zhes sems can gyis sems can la brnyas par gyur to //
analyzed: khyod ni kha dog ngan pa yin no zhes sems can gyis sems can la brnyas par gyur to //
translated: “I am beautiful, you are ugly.”

original: kha dog gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de dag gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag nyid yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir sa'i bcud nub par gyur to //
analyzed: kha dog gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de dag gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag nyid yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir sa'i bcud nub par gyur to //
translated: Because of their pride in their complexions, and because of their adoption of sinful and nonvirtuous actions, the essence of the earth disappeared.

original: de nas sems can de dag 'dus shing tshogs nas mya ngan byed cing yi chad la smre sngags 'don te /
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag 'dus shing tshogs nas mya ngan byed cing yi chad la smre sngags 'don te /
translated: Then those beings gathered together, lamented, and cried out,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: saying:

original: kye hu sa'i bcud kye hud sa'i bcud ces kyang 'dzer te /
analyzed: kye hu sa'i bcud kye hud sa'i bcud ces kyang 'dzer te /
translated: “Alas, the essence of the earth! Alas, the essence of the earth!”

translated: Thus, what was previously known as non-Dharma is now known as Dharma among humans.

analyzed: sngon chos ma yin par grags pa de ni da ltar gyi bsngags par gyur ro //

translated: We should gather rice for two days, three days, and up to seven days.” They gathered rice for seven days.
