original: kye bdag cag sngon gyi gzugs bzang zhing yid la skyes pa dang / ma nyams shing dbang po tshang ba yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad dang ldan te /
analyzed: kye bdag cag sngon gyi gzugs bzang zhing yid la skyes pa dang / ma nyams shing dbang po tshang ba yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad dang ldan te /
translated: “Oh! Previously we had good complexions, were born from the mind, were not subject to degeneration, had complete faculties, and had all our major and minor body parts.

original: rang las 'od 'byung ba dang / nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / bzang zhing mdog sdug pa dang / dga' ba'i bza' ba rnams dang dga' ba'i zas rnams za la @62b tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas te /
analyzed: rang las 'od 'byung ba dang / nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / bzang zhing mdog sdug pa dang / dga' ba'i bza' ba rnams dang dga' ba'i zas rnams za la @62b tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas te /
translated: We emitted light from our bodies, moved through space, had good complexions, ate food that was delightful and delicious, and had long lives and long life spans.

original: bdag cag las gang kha zas ches mang du za ba de ni kha dog ngan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag cag las gang kha zas ches mang du za ba de ni kha dog ngan par 'gyur la /
translated: Those among us who ate more food had bad complexions.

original: gang kha zas ches nyung ngu za ba de ni kha dog bzang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang kha zas ches nyung ngu za ba de ni kha dog bzang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Those who ate less food had good complexions.

original: de ltar kha zas sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis kha dog kyang sna tshogs yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar kha zas sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis kha dog kyang sna tshogs yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, due to the condition of various foods, various colors also arise.

original: kha dog sna tshogs yod par gyur pas /🔽kye sems can nga ni kha dog bzang ba yin no //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs yod par gyur pas / kye sems can nga ni kha dog bzang ba yin no //
translated: Due to the existence of various colors,🔽sentient beings despise other sentient beings, saying, “I am beautiful,🔽you are ugly.”

original: khyod ni kha dog ngan pa yin no zhes sems can gyis sems can la brnyas par gyur la bdag cag kha dog gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams kyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag nyid yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir sa'i bcud nub par gyur
analyzed: khyod ni kha dog ngan pa yin no zhes sems can gyis sems can la brnyas par gyur la bdag cag kha dog gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams kyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag nyid yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir sa'i bcud nub par gyur
translated: We who are proud of our beauty have taken up those very sinful and nonvirtuous things, and so the essence of the earth has disappeared.

original: nas / sa zhag kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa dang / ro phun sum tshogs pa byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: nas / sa zhag kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa dang / ro phun sum tshogs pa byung bar gyur te /
translated: Then, the earth’s surface, which was perfect in color, perfect in smell, and perfect in taste, arose.

original: kha dog ni dper na dong ka'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: kha dog ni dper na dong ka'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: Its color was like that of the donkya flower.

original: ro ni dper na sbrang ma'i sbrang rtsi ma bskol ba bzhin te /
analyzed: ro ni dper na sbrang ma'i sbrang rtsi ma bskol ba bzhin te /
translated: Its taste was like that of unboiled honey.

original: bdag cag bza' ba de dang kha zas nge za la tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas te /
analyzed: bdag cag bza' ba de dang kha zas nge za la tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas te /
translated: We eat this food and that food. We live long and endure for a long time.

original: bdag cag las kha zas ches mang du za ba de ni kha dog ngan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag cag las kha zas ches mang du za ba de ni kha dog ngan par 'gyur la /
translated: Those of us who eat more food have bad complexions.

original: gang kha zas ches nyung du za ba de ni kha dog bzang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang kha zas ches nyung du za ba de ni kha dog bzang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those of us who eat less food have good complexions.

original: de ltar kha zas sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis kha dog sna tshogs yod par gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar kha zas sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis kha dog sna tshogs yod par gyur to //
translated: In this way, because of the various foods, there came to be various complexions.

original: kha dog sna tshogs yod par gyur pas /🔽kye sems can nga ni kha dog bzang ba yin no //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs yod par gyur pas / kye sems can nga ni kha dog bzang ba yin no //
translated: Because there were various complexions,🔽one sentient being looked down on another sentient being, saying, “Oh! I have a good complexion.

original: khyod ni kha dog ngan pa yin no zhes sems can gyis sems can la brnyas par gyur te /
analyzed: khyod ni kha dog ngan pa yin no zhes sems can gyis sems can la brnyas par gyur te /
translated: You have a bad complexion.”

original: bdag cag kha dog gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams kyis yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag nyid yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir sa zhag nub par gyur nas /
analyzed: bdag cag kha dog gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams kyis yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag nyid yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir sa zhag nub par gyur nas /
translated: We who have the pride of good complexion took up those very sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas again, and so the earth’s crust disappeared.

original: ldum bu'i tshal kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa dang / ro phun sum tshogs pa byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: ldum bu'i tshal kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa dang / ro phun sum tshogs pa byung bar gyur to //
translated: A forest of plants appeared, with perfect color, perfect smell, and perfect taste.

original: kha dog ni dper na ka dam bu ka'i me tog bzhin la /
analyzed: kha dog ni dper na ka dam bu ka'i me tog bzhin la /
translated: The color was like the kaṇṭakī flower.

original: ro ni dper na sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi ma bskol ba bzhin te /
analyzed: ro ni dper na sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi ma bskol ba bzhin te /
translated: The taste was like uncooked honey.

original: bdag cag bza' ba de dang kha zas de dag za la tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas te /
analyzed: bdag cag bza' ba de dang kha zas de dag za la tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas te /
translated: We ate that food and lived a long time.

original: bdag cag las gang kha zas ches mang du za ba de ni kha dog ngan bar gyur la gang kha zas ches nyung du za ba de ni kha dog bzang bar gyur te /🔽de ltar kha zas sna tshogs kyi rkyen kyis kha dog sna tshogs yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag cag las gang kha zas ches mang du za ba de ni kha dog ngan bar gyur la gang kha zas ches nyung du za ba de ni kha dog bzang bar gyur te / de ltar kha zas sna tshogs kyi rkyen kyis kha dog sna tshogs yod par 'gyur la /
translated: Those who ate more food had bad complexions, while those who ate less had good complexions.

original: kha dog sna @63a * //
analyzed: kha dog sna @63a * //
translated: In this way, because of the variety of food, there was a variety of complexions.

original: tshogs yod par gyur pas kye sems can nga ni kha dog bzang ba yin no //
analyzed: tshogs yod par gyur pas kye sems can nga ni kha dog bzang ba yin no //
translated: Because of the variety of complexions, some beings said, “I am beautiful, but those others are ugly.”

original: khyod ni kha dog ngan pa yin no zhes sems can gyis sems can la brnyas par gyur te /
analyzed: khyod ni kha dog ngan pa yin no zhes sems can gyis sems can la brnyas par gyur te /
translated: Because we beings had such contempt for each other,

original: bdag cag kha dog gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams kyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag nyid yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir ldum bu'i tshal nub par gyur te /
analyzed: bdag cag kha dog gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams kyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag nyid yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir ldum bu'i tshal nub par gyur te /
translated: we beings who were proud of our complexions took up those very sinful, nonvirtuous actions, and so the forest disappeared.

original: ma rmos ma btab pa'i 'bras s'a lu'i 'bru kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa dang / ro phun sum tshogs pa byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: ma rmos ma btab pa'i 'bras s'a lu'i 'bru kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa dang / ro phun sum tshogs pa byung bar gyur te /
translated: Unplanted, unplowed rice appeared, with perfect color, perfect smell, and perfect taste.

original: gzegs ma med cing phub ma med la dag cing gtsang ste /
analyzed: gzegs ma med cing phub ma med la dag cing gtsang ste /
translated: It was free of chaff and dust, pure and clean,

original: sor bzhi tsam la yongs su g-yogs pa med pa de nang brngas na nub skye /
analyzed: sor bzhi tsam la yongs su g-yogs pa med pa de nang brngas na nub skye /
translated: and grew to a height of four fingers’ width without being planted.🔽When it was harvested in the morning, it grew again in the evening;

original: nub brngas na nang skye ba dang / de ltar brngas shing skye la brngas par yang mi mngon te /
analyzed: nub brngas na nang skye ba dang / de ltar brngas shing skye la brngas par yang mi mngon te /
translated: when it was harvested in the evening, it grew again in the morning.

original: bdag cag bza' ba de dang kha zas de la za la tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas te /
analyzed: bdag cag bza' ba de dang kha zas de la za la tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas te /
translated: We ate that food and that rice, and we lived for a very long time.

original: gang gi phyir bdag cag gis ma rmos ma btab pa'i 'bras s'a la'i 'bru kun du bsags pa'i tshul gyis longs spyod pas longs spyod pa des na s'a lu de las gzegs ma dang phub ma yang byung bar gyur /🔽brdas so cog kyang mi skye la brdas pa yang mngon bar gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag cag gis ma rmos ma btab pa'i 'bras s'a la'i 'bru kun du bsags pa'i tshul gyis longs spyod pas longs spyod pa des na s'a lu de las gzegs ma dang phub ma yang byung bar gyur / brdas so cog kyang mi skye la brdas pa yang mngon bar gyur te /
translated: “Since we have enjoyed the harvest of rice that grows wild without cultivation, the rice has become covered with husks and powder.

original: s'a lu rnams phung po phung por bzhag go //🔽da ni bdag cag gis 'di ni khyod kyi'o //
analyzed: s'a lu rnams phung po phung por bzhag go // da ni bdag cag gis 'di ni khyod kyi'o //
translated: The rice no longer grows without planting, and the rice plants have become covered with husks and powder.🔽The rice is now harvested in bundles.

original: 'di ni nga'i 'o zhes zhing rnams gzhal zhing bgos la /🔽mu thug bri'o zhes nas de dag 'di ni khyod kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i 'o zhes zhing rnams gzhal zhing bgos la / mu thug bri'o zhes nas de dag 'di ni khyod kyi'o //
translated: Now we must divide the fields and set boundaries, saying, ‘This is yours, this is mine.’🔽We must draw the boundaries and set the boundaries.”🔽They divided the fields and set boundaries, saying, “This is yours, this is mine.”

original: 'di ni nga'i 'o zhes zhing rnams 'jal zhing bkyed mu thug 'dri'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i 'o zhes zhing rnams 'jal zhing bkyed mu thug 'dri'o //
translated: They drew the boundaries and set the boundaries.

original: de nas sems can gzhan zhig gis bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par blangs so //
analyzed: de nas sems can gzhan zhig gis bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par blangs so //
translated: Then another being, while having rice of his own, took the rice of another without giving anything in return.

original: sems can gzhan zhig gis sems can de bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par len pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems can gzhan zhig gis sems can de bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par len pa mthong ngo //
translated: Another sentient being saw that sentient being taking the rice of another while his own rice was still there.

original: mthong nas kyang 'di skad du /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang 'di skad du /
translated: Having seen that, he said this:

original: ngan zhing blun pa'i sems can khyod ni mi bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngan zhing blun pa'i sems can khyod ni mi bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: “You are a bad and foolish sentient being who does what should not be done.

original: kye sems can bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par len pa dag ga la srid /
analyzed: kye sems can bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par len pa dag ga la srid /
translated: Hey, sentient being, while your own rice is still there, how could you take the rice of another without giving anything in return?

original: kye sems can khyod song la da phyin chad de ltar ma byed cig ces smras so //
analyzed: kye sems can khyod song la da phyin chad de ltar ma byed cig ces smras so //
translated: Hey, sentient being, you should go and from now on not do that.”

original: de nas sems can des bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par blangs so //
analyzed: de nas sems can des bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par blangs so //
translated: Then that sentient being, while his own rice was still there, took the rice of another without giving anything in return a second and a third time.

original: sems can de dag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du ma byin par len pa sems can @63b des mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du ma byin par len pa sems can @63b des mthong ngo //
translated: That sentient being saw that sentient being take the rice of another without giving anything in return a second and a third time while his own rice was still there.

original: mthong nas kyang 'di skad du /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang 'di skad du /
translated: Having seen that, he said this:

original: ngan zhing blun pa'i sems can khyod ni mi bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngan zhing blun pa'i sems can khyod ni mi bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: “You are a bad and foolish sentient being who does what should not be done.

original: kye sems can khyod bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par len pa dag ga la srid ces smras te /
analyzed: kye sems can khyod bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par len pa dag ga la srid ces smras te /
translated: He said, Oh, sentient beings, how can you take what is not given, taking another's sālu while you have your own?

original: de'i lag pa gnyis nas kyang bzung nas de tshur 'dren phar 'dren la de'i tshe 'khor gyi nang du yang bkug ste /
analyzed: de'i lag pa gnyis nas kyang bzung nas de tshur 'dren phar 'dren la de'i tshe 'khor gyi nang du yang bkug ste /
translated: He grabbed that sentient being by the arms and dragged him here and there. At that time, he was also brought into the assembly.

original: sems can dag gang sems can 'dis bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par blangs pa shes par gyis shig ces smras so //
analyzed: sems can dag gang sems can 'dis bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par blangs pa shes par gyis shig ces smras so //
translated: He said, Sentient beings, know that this sentient being, while having his own sālu, took another's sālu without giving the price.

original: de nas sems can de dag gis sems can de la 'di skad du ngan zhing blun pa'i sems can khyod ni mi bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag gis sems can de la 'di skad du ngan zhing blun pa'i sems can khyod ni mi bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: Then those sentient beings said to that sentient being, You are a bad and foolish sentient being who does what should not be done.

original: khyod bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par len ba dag ga la srid /
analyzed: khyod bdag gi s'a lu yod bzhin du gzhan gyi s'a lu ma byin par len ba dag ga la srid /
translated: How can you take another's sālu without giving the price while you have your own sālu?

original: kye sems can khyod song la phyin chad de ltar ma byed cig ces smras so //
analyzed: kye sems can khyod song la phyin chad de ltar ma byed cig ces smras so //
translated: Oh, sentient being, go and do not do that again.

original: de nas des sems can dag gang sems can 'dis s'a lu'i phyir bdag tshur drangs phar drangs te /
analyzed: de nas des sems can dag gang sems can 'dis s'a lu'i phyir bdag tshur drangs phar drangs te /
translated: Then, they will know that this being has been bringing other beings to and fro for the sake of rice.

original: 'khor gyi nang du yang bkug pa shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du yang bkug pa shes par gyis shig /
translated: They will also know that he has been bringing them to the assembly.

original: de nas sems can de dag gis sems can de la 'di skad du /
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag gis sems can de la 'di skad du /
translated: Then, those beings will say to that being,

original: kye sems can khyod kyis s'a lu'i phyir sems can tshur drangs phar drangs la 'khor gyi nang du yang bkug ste ci bya /
analyzed: kye sems can khyod kyis s'a lu'i phyir sems can tshur drangs phar drangs la 'khor gyi nang du yang bkug ste ci bya /
translated: ‘Hey, being! Why have you been bringing other beings to and fro for the sake of rice, and why have you been bringing them to the assembly?’

original: kye sems can khyod song la phyin chad de ltar ma byed cig ces smras so //
analyzed: kye sems can khyod song la phyin chad de ltar ma byed cig ces smras so //
translated: ‘Hey, being! Go away and don’t do that again!’

original: de nas sems can de dag 'di snyam du s'a lu'i phyir 'dren pa dang 'khor gyi nang du yang 'gugs pa dag snang gi /
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag 'di snyam du s'a lu'i phyir 'dren pa dang 'khor gyi nang du yang 'gugs pa dag snang gi /
translated: Then, those beings will think, ‘It seems that bringing to and fro and bringing to the assembly is for the sake of rice.

original: bdag cag 'dus la bdag cag gis nang na sems can gang ches gzugs bzang ba dang / ches blta na sdug pa dang / ches mdzes pa dang / ches dbang che bar grags pa de bdag cag gis zhing gi dpon por bskos nas /🔽bdag cag la dus dus su chad pas bcad pa'i rigs pa gang yin pa rnams la ni chad pas gcod par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag cag 'dus la bdag cag gis nang na sems can gang ches gzugs bzang ba dang / ches blta na sdug pa dang / ches mdzes pa dang / ches dbang che bar grags pa de bdag cag gis zhing gi dpon por bskos nas / bdag cag la dus dus su chad pas bcad pa'i rigs pa gang yin pa rnams la ni chad pas gcod par 'gyur /
translated: We should gather together and appoint the sentient being who is most handsome, most beautiful, most attractive, and most renowned for his great power as our lord of the field.🔽When it is appropriate to punish, he will punish us.

original: phan gdags pa'i rigs pa rnams la ni phan 'dogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phan gdags pa'i rigs pa rnams la ni phan 'dogs par 'gyur te /
translated: When it is appropriate to benefit us, he will benefit us.

original: gang bdag cag gi zhing rnams las skyes pa de las bdag cag gis dus dus su chos bzhin byed thog shas sbyin par bya'o snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: gang bdag cag gi zhing rnams las skyes pa de las bdag cag gis dus dus su chos bzhin byed thog shas sbyin par bya'o snyam du bsams so //
translated: We will give him a share of what we have produced from our fields, in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de nas sems can de dag 'dus nas de dag gi nang na sems can gang ches gzugs bzang ba dang / ches blta na sdug pa dang / ches mdzes pa dang / ches dbang che bar grags pa gang yin pa'i sems can de la 'di skad du /
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag 'dus nas de dag gi nang na sems can gang ches gzugs bzang ba dang / ches blta na sdug pa dang / ches mdzes pa dang / ches dbang che bar grags pa gang yin pa'i sems can de la 'di skad du /
translated: Then those sentient beings gathered together and said to the sentient being who was the most handsome, the most attractive, the most beautiful, and the most renowned for his great power,

original: @64a * // kye sems can khyod tshur shog /
analyzed: @64a * // kye sems can khyod tshur shog /
translated: “Hey, sentient being, come here!

original: bdag cag gi zhing gi bdag po legs pa kho nar byos la /
analyzed: bdag cag gi zhing gi bdag po legs pa kho nar byos la /
translated: Be the lord of our fields in the best way possible.

original: sems can bdag cag las chad pas bcad pa'i rigs pa rnams ni chad pas chod cig / phan gdags pa'i rigs pa rnams la ni phan thogs shig /
analyzed: sems can bdag cag las chad pas bcad pa'i rigs pa rnams ni chad pas chod cig / phan gdags pa'i rigs pa rnams la ni phan thogs shig /
translated: Those sentient beings who deserve to be punished by us, punish them! Those who deserve to be helped, help them!

original: bdag cag gi zhing rnams las skyes pa gang yin pa de las kyang bdag cag gis dus su chos bzhin du thog shas sbyin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: bdag cag gi zhing rnams las skyes pa gang yin pa de las kyang bdag cag gis dus su chos bzhin du thog shas sbyin no zhes smras so //
translated: We will give you a fair share of the harvest from our fields in a timely manner and in accordance with the Dharma.”

original: de nas skye bo mang pos bkur to zhes nas mang pos bkur ba mang pos bkur ba zhes ming du chags so //
analyzed: de nas skye bo mang pos bkur to zhes nas mang pos bkur ba mang pos bkur ba zhes ming du chags so //
translated: Then, because he was honored by the multitude, he became known as Mahasammata, “honored by the multitude.”

original: zhing rnams kyi bdag por gyur pa dang / phongs pa las skyob pa'i phyir rgyal rigs rgyal rigs zhes bya bar ming du chags so //
analyzed: zhing rnams kyi bdag por gyur pa dang / phongs pa las skyob pa'i phyir rgyal rigs rgyal rigs zhes bya bar ming du chags so //
translated: Because they became the lords of the fields and protected the poor, the name kṣatriya, “protector of the fields,” came into existence.

original: chos dang tshul khrims kyi tshul kun du spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi tshul kyang kun tu spyod pas 'khor mgu bar byed pa'i phyir rgyal po zhes bya bar ming du chags so //
analyzed: chos dang tshul khrims kyi tshul kun du spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi tshul kyang kun tu spyod pas 'khor mgu bar byed pa'i phyir rgyal po zhes bya bar ming du chags so //
translated: Because they practiced the way of Dharma and morality and also practiced the way of wisdom, they pleased the retinue, and the name rāja, “one who pleases the retinue,” came into existence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gnas 'jog dang ba ra dhva dza lung bstan pa las 'di skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gnas 'jog dang ba ra dhva dza lung bstan pa las 'di skad du /
translated: The Blessed One also said in the Vyākaraṇa of Vasiṣṭha Bharadvāja:

original: gnas 'jog ci'i rgyu dang ci'i rkyen gyis rgyal rigs kyi cho rigs 'jig rten du byung zhe na /
analyzed: gnas 'jog ci'i rgyu dang ci'i rkyen gyis rgyal rigs kyi cho rigs 'jig rten du byung zhe na /
translated: “Vasiṣṭha, for what reason and for what condition did the kṣatriya caste come into existence in the world?”

original: 'jig rten 'di 'jig cing 'jig pa'i tshe 'jig na sems can phal cher 'od gsal gyi lha'i rigs su skye ba de'i dus kyang yod la de'i skabs kyang yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di 'jig cing 'jig pa'i tshe 'jig na sems can phal cher 'od gsal gyi lha'i rigs su skye ba de'i dus kyang yod la de'i skabs kyang yod de /
translated: “Vasiṣṭha, when this world is destroyed and is being destroyed, when it is destroyed, most sentient beings are born in the class of Ābhāsvara gods. There is a time for that and there is an occasion for that.

original: de dag der gzugs bzang zhing yid las skyes pa dang / ma nyams shing dbang po tshang ba dang / yan lag dang nying lag thams cad dang ldan pa dang / bzang zhing mdog sdug pa dang / rang las 'od 'byung ba dang / nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang /

translated: They are born from the mind, have perfect faculties, are complete in all major and minor body parts, are beautiful, have a pleasant complexion, emit their own light, and travel through space.

original: dga' ba'i bza' ba dang / dga' ba'i zas za ba dang / tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ba de'i dus kyang yod la de'i skabs kyang yod do //
analyzed: dga' ba'i bza' ba dang / dga' ba'i zas za ba dang / tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ba de'i dus kyang yod la de'i skabs kyang yod do //
translated: They have food and drink that they enjoy, live long, and remain for a long time.

original: 'jig rten 'di chags shing 'chags pa na 'jig rten du sa chen po 'di chu gcig cing rgya mtsho gcig tu 'gyur ba de'i dus kyang yod la de'i skabs kyang yod de /

original: chu gcig cing rgya mtsho gcig tu gyur pa'i sa chen po'i steng du rlung gis spris ma kun tu bsdus shing kun tu 'thas bar byas pa nas snga ma bzhin du rgyas par skye bo mang pos bkur ba zhes ming du chags pa dang / zhing rnams kyi bdag por gyur pa dang /

translated: The name Mahāsaṃmata arose as before.🔽The name kṣatriya arose because they became the lords of the fields and protected the poor.

original: phongs pa las skyob pa'i phyir rgyal rigs rgyal rigs zhes bya bar ming @64b du chags pa dang / chos dang tshul khrims kyi tshul kun tu spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi tshul kun tu spyod pas 'khor mgu bar byed pa'i phyir rgyal po rgyal po zhes bya bar ming du chags pa'i bar du thams cad brjod par bya ste /

original: gnas 'jog 'di ni rgyal rigs cho rigs 'jig rten du byung ba'i gtan tshigs kyi mchog yin te de yang chos bzhin du byed pa yin te chos ma yin pas ni ma yin no //

analyzed: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po dka' thub spyod ces bya ba byung ste /
translated: After them, a king called Ascetic appeared.

original: rgyal po dka' thub spyod kyi bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po brgyad khri bzhi stong gis yang grong khyer ku shi ldan du rgyal srid kyi @67b dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po dka' thub spyod kyi bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po brgyad khri bzhi stong gis yang grong khyer ku shi ldan du rgyal srid kyi @67b dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
translated: The eighty-four thousand kings who were his descendants ruled in the city of Kuśāvatī.

original: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po sa gtso zhes bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po sa gtso zhes bya ba byung ste /
translated: After them, a king called Earth Lord appeared.

original: rgyal po sa gtso'i bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po stong gis yang grong khyer w'a r'a na s'ir rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po sa gtso'i bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po stong gis yang grong khyer w'a r'a na s'ir rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
translated: The thousand kings who were his descendants ruled in the city of Vārāṇasī.

original: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal pos bdag ces bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal pos bdag ces bya ba byung ste /
translated: After them, a king called Self appeared.

original: rgyal po sa bdag gi bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po stong gis yang grong khyer 'thab med du rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po sa bdag gi bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po stong gis yang grong khyer 'thab med du rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
translated: One thousand kings, descendants of the son, grandson, and great-grandson of King Mahārāja, ruled over the kingdom in the city of Anupamā.

original: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po sa 'dzin zhes bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po sa 'dzin zhes bya ba byung ste /
translated: After them, a king named Dhṛtarāṣṭra appeared.

original: rgyal po sa 'dzin gyi bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po brgyad khri bzhi stong gis yang 'dres pa'i grong khyer du rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po sa 'dzin gyi bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po brgyad khri bzhi stong gis yang 'dres pa'i grong khyer du rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
translated: Eighty-four thousand kings, descendants of the son, grandson, and great-grandson of King Dhṛtarāṣṭra, ruled over the kingdom in the city of Pūrvavideha.

original: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po lha chen po zhes bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po lha chen po zhes bya ba byung ste /
translated: After them, a king named Mahādeva appeared.

original: rgyal po lha chen po'i bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po brgyad khri bzhi stong gis yang grong khyer 'dres par rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas nas thams cad dang 'dres pa de nyid dang / lha chen po'i aa mra'i tshal de nyid du rgyal po drang srong du gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal po lha chen po'i bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po brgyad khri bzhi stong gis yang grong khyer 'dres par rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas nas thams cad dang 'dres pa de nyid dang / lha chen po'i aa mra'i tshal de nyid du rgyal po drang srong du gyur te /
translated: The eighty-four thousand kings who were the descendants of Mahendraka, his sons, grandsons, and great-grandsons, all of them, ruled over the kingdom in the city of Pundravardhana.

original: drang srong gi tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
analyzed: drang srong gi tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
translated: In that very mango grove of Mahendraka, they became sages and practiced the pure conduct of sages.

original: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po nges 'phen zhes bya ba byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po nges 'phen zhes bya ba byung ngo //
translated: After them, there was a king named Nemi.

original: nges 'phen gyi bu ni mu khyud do //🔽mu khyud kyi bu ni mu khyud brtan no //
analyzed: nges 'phen gyi bu ni mu khyud do // mu khyud kyi bu ni mu khyud brtan no //
translated: Nemi's son was Cakra.🔽Cakra's son was Cakradhara.

original: mu khyud brtan gyi bu ni tshan bo che'o //
analyzed: mu khyud brtan gyi bu ni tshan bo che'o //
translated: Cakradhara's son was Mahāsenaka.

original: tshan po che'i bu ni za ba'o //🔽za ba'i bu ni nye za'o //
analyzed: tshan po che'i bu ni za ba'o // za ba'i bu ni nye za'o //
translated: Mahāsenaka's son was Bhakṣa.🔽Bhakṣa's son was Upabhakṣa.

original: nye ba'i bu ni za ba can no //🔽za ba can gyi bu ni za ldan no //
analyzed: nye ba'i bu ni za ba can no // za ba can gyi bu ni za ldan no //
translated: Upabhakṣa's son was Bhakṣaka.🔽Bhakṣaka's son was Bhakṣaṇa.

original: za ldan gyi bu ni gya nom snang ba'o //
analyzed: za ldan gyi bu ni gya nom snang ba'o //
translated: Bhakṣaṇa's son was Sudarśana.

original: gya nom snang ba'i bu ni mnyam lta'o //
analyzed: gya nom snang ba'i bu ni mnyam lta'o //
translated: The son of the one with the appearance of excellence is the one with equal vision.

original: mnyam lta'i bu ni thos pa'i sde'o //
analyzed: mnyam lta'i bu ni thos pa'i sde'o //
translated: The son of the one with equal vision is the one with the assembly of hearing.

original: thos pa'i sde'i bu ni chos kyi sde'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i sde'i bu ni chos kyi sde'o //
translated: The son of the one with the assembly of hearing is the one with the assembly of Dharma.

original: chos kyi sde'i bu ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sde'i bu ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: The son of the one with the assembly of Dharma is the one with realization.

original: rtogs pa'i bu ni rtogs chen no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bu ni rtogs chen no //
translated: The son of the one with realization is the one with great realization.

original: rtogs chen gyi bu ni rtogs sde'o //
analyzed: rtogs chen gyi bu ni rtogs sde'o //
translated: The son of the one with great realization is the one with the assembly of realization.

original: rtogs sde'i bu ni mya ngan med do //
analyzed: rtogs sde'i bu ni mya ngan med do //
translated: The son of the one with the assembly of realization is the one without sorrow.

original: mya ngan med pa'i bu ni mya ngan bral lo //
analyzed: mya ngan med pa'i bu ni mya ngan bral lo //
translated: The son of the one without sorrow is the one free from sorrow.

original: mya ngan bral gyi bu ni mtshams brtan no //
analyzed: mya ngan bral gyi bu ni mtshams brtan no //
translated: The son of the one free from sorrow is the one with firm boundaries.

original: mtshams brtan gyi bu ni rgan mtshams so //🔽rgan mtshams kyi bu ni dun ma ra'o //
analyzed: mtshams brtan gyi bu ni rgan mtshams so // rgan mtshams kyi bu ni dun ma ra'o //
translated: The son of the one with firm boundaries is the one with old boundaries.🔽The son of the one with old boundaries is the one with the Dunma.

original: dun ma ra'i bu ni skya rengs so //🔽skya rengs kyi bu ni phyogs bdag go //
analyzed: dun ma ra'i bu ni skya rengs so // skya rengs kyi bu ni phyogs bdag go //
translated: The son of the one with the Dunma is the one with the dawn.🔽The son of the one with the dawn is the one with the direction lord.

original: phyogs bdag gi bu ni rdul bzang ngo //
analyzed: phyogs bdag gi bu ni rdul bzang ngo //
translated: The son of the one with the direction lord is the one with good dust.

original: rdul bzang gi bu ni bde byed do //🔽bde byed kyi bu ni kun dga'o //
analyzed: rdul bzang gi bu ni bde byed do // bde byed kyi bu ni kun dga'o //
translated: The son of the one with good dust is the one who brings happiness.🔽The son of the one who brings happiness is the one with universal joy.

original: kun dga'i bu ni me long zhal lo //
analyzed: kun dga'i bu ni me long zhal lo //
translated: The son of the one with universal joy is the one with the mirror face.

original: me long zhal gyi bu ni skyed pa'o //
analyzed: me long zhal gyi bu ni skyed pa'o //
translated: The son of the one with the mirror face is the one who generates.

original: skyed pa'i bu ni rgyal ba khyu mchog go //
analyzed: skyed pa'i bu ni rgyal ba khyu mchog go //
translated: The son of the one who is born is the Victorious One, the best of herds.

original: rgyal ba khyu mchog gi bu ni bza' btung ldan no //
analyzed: rgyal ba khyu mchog gi bu ni bza' btung ldan no //
translated: The son of the Victorious One, the best of herds, is the one who has food and drink.

original: @68a * // bza' btung ldan gyi bu ni bza' btung mod do //
analyzed: @68a * // bza' btung ldan gyi bu ni bza' btung mod do //
translated: The son of the one who has food and drink is the one who has plenty of food and drink.

original: gza' btung mod kyi bu ni thub med do //
analyzed: gza' btung mod kyi bu ni thub med do //
translated: The son of the one who has plenty of food and drink is the one who is not defeated.

original: thub med kyi bu ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa'o //
analyzed: thub med kyi bu ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa'o //
translated: The son of the one who is not defeated is the one who cannot be defeated by others.

original: gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i bu ni brtan po'o //🔽brtan po'i bu ni rab tu brtan no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i bu ni brtan po'o // brtan po'i bu ni rab tu brtan no //
translated: The son of the one who cannot be defeated by others is the steadfast one.🔽The son of the steadfast one is the very steadfast one.

original: rab tu brtan gyi bu ni stobs po che'o //
analyzed: rab tu brtan gyi bu ni stobs po che'o //
translated: The son of the very steadfast one is the very powerful one.

original: stobs po che'i bu ni bzhon pa mang ngo //
analyzed: stobs po che'i bu ni bzhon pa mang ngo //
translated: The son of the very powerful one is the one with many vehicles.

original: bzhon pa mang gi bu ni blo bzang ngo //
analyzed: bzhon pa mang gi bu ni blo bzang ngo //
translated: The son of the one with many vehicles is the one with good intelligence.

original: blo bzang gi bu ni brtan gzhon no //
analyzed: blo bzang gi bu ni brtan gzhon no //
translated: The son of the one with good intelligence is the youthful steadfast one.

original: brtan gzhon gyi bu ni gzhu bcu pa'o //
analyzed: brtan gzhon gyi bu ni gzhu bcu pa'o //
translated: The son of the youthful steadfast one is the one with ten bows.

original: gzhu bcu pa'i bu ni gzhu brgya pa'o //
analyzed: gzhu bcu pa'i bu ni gzhu brgya pa'o //
translated: The son of the one with ten bows is the one with a hundred bows.

original: gzhu brgya pa'i bu ni gzhu dgu bcu pa'o //
analyzed: gzhu brgya pa'i bu ni gzhu dgu bcu pa'o //
translated: The son of the one with a hundred bows is the one with ninety-nine bows.

original: gzhu dgu bcu pa'i bu ni rnam par rgyal ba'i gzhu'o //
analyzed: gzhu dgu bcu pa'i bu ni rnam par rgyal ba'i gzhu'o //
translated: The son of the one with ninety-nine bows is the victorious bow.

original: rnam par rgyal ba'i gzhu'i bu ni gzhu bkra'o //
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i gzhu'i bu ni gzhu bkra'o //
translated: The son of the victorious bow is the colorful bow.

original: gzhu bkra'i bu ni gzhu sra'o //
analyzed: gzhu bkra'i bu ni gzhu sra'o //
translated: The son of Dhanurdhara was Dhanurdhara.

original: gzhu sra'i bu ni gzhu brtan no //🔽gzhu brtan pa'i bu ni shing rta bcu pa'o //
analyzed: gzhu sra'i bu ni gzhu brtan no // gzhu brtan pa'i bu ni shing rta bcu pa'o //
translated: The son of Dhanurdhara was Dhanusthira.🔽The son of Dhanusthira was Daśaratha.

original: shing rta bcu pa'i bu ni shing rta brgya pa'o //
analyzed: shing rta bcu pa'i bu ni shing rta brgya pa'o //
translated: The son of Daśaratha was Śatratha.🔽The son of Śatratha was Navaratha.

original: shing rta brgya pa'i bu ni shing rta dgu bcu pa'o //🔽shing rta dgu bcu pa'i bu ni shing rta sna tshogs pa'o //🔽shing rta sna tshogs pa'i bu ni shing rta rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: shing rta brgya pa'i bu ni shing rta dgu bcu pa'o // shing rta dgu bcu pa'i bu ni shing rta sna tshogs pa'o // shing rta sna tshogs pa'i bu ni shing rta rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The son of Navaratha was Citraratha.🔽The son of Citraratha was Viśeṣaratha.

original: shing rta rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bu ni shing rta brling pa'o //
analyzed: shing rta rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bu ni shing rta brling pa'o //
translated: The son of Viśeṣaratha was Dṛḍharatha.

original: shing rta brling pa'i bu ni shing rta brtan no //
analyzed: shing rta brling pa'i bu ni shing rta brtan no //
translated: The son of Dṛḍharatha was Dṛḍhadhanvan.

original: rgyal po shing rta brtan gyi bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po bdun khri bdun stong gis grong khyer legs par snang du rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po shing rta brtan gyi bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po bdun khri bdun stong gis grong khyer legs par snang du rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
translated: The lineage of the sons, grandsons, and great-grandsons of King Dṛḍhadhanvan, consisting of seventy-seven thousand kings, ruled in the city of Sudarśana.

original: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po nam mkha'i bdag po zhes bya ba byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po nam mkha'i bdag po zhes bya ba byung ngo //
translated: After them, there was a king called Ākāśa.

original: rgyal po nam mkha'i bdag po'i bu ni klus bsrungs so //
analyzed: rgyal po nam mkha'i bdag po'i bu ni klus bsrungs so //
translated: The son of King Ākāśa was Nāgarakṣita.

original: rgyal po klus bsrungs kyi bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po brgyas yang grong khyer b'a r'a na s'ir rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po klus bsrungs kyi bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po brgyas yang grong khyer b'a r'a na s'ir rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
translated: The son of King Nāgarakṣita, and the sons of his sons and grandsons, one hundred kings in all, ruled the kingdom of Vārāṇasī.

original: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po kr'i ki zhes bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po kr'i ki zhes bya ba byung ste /
translated: After them, there was a king called Kṛkī.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: At that time, the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the One with Perfect Knowledge and Conduct,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: the Well-Gone One,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /🔽skyes bu 'dul ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa / skyes bu 'dul ba /
translated: the Knower of the World,

original: kha lo sgyur ba /🔽bla na med pa /
analyzed: kha lo sgyur ba / bla na med pa /
translated: the Trainer of Human Beings to be Tamed,🔽the Teacher of Gods and Men,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: the Blessed Buddha Kāśyapa appeared in the world.

original: der byang chub sems dpa' bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs las ma 'ongs pa'i dus su byang chub pa'i phyir smon lam btab cing tshangs @68b par spyod pa spyod nas dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris su skyes te /
analyzed: der byang chub sems dpa' bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs las ma 'ongs pa'i dus su byang chub pa'i phyir smon lam btab cing tshangs @68b par spyod pa spyod nas dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris su skyes te /
translated: There, the Bodhisattva, having made a vow to attain Awakening in the future to the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened Buddha Kāśyapa, and having practiced pure conduct, was reborn in the Tuṣita heaven.

original: de de na tshe'i tshad ji srid du gnas so //
analyzed: de de na tshe'i tshad ji srid du gnas so //
translated: He remained there for as long as his lifespan.

original: rgyal po kr'i ki'i bu ni legs par skyes zhes bya bar gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal po kr'i ki'i bu ni legs par skyes zhes bya bar gyur te /
translated: The son of King Kṛkī became known as Suprabuddha.

original: rgyal po legs par skyes kyi bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po brgyas yang grong khyer gru 'dzin du rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po legs par skyes kyi bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud kyi rgyal po brgyas yang grong khyer gru 'dzin du rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
translated: The one hundred kings in the lineage of King Suprabuddha's sons, grandsons, and great-grandsons ruled over the kingdom in the city of Kuśinagarī.

original: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po rna ba zhes bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po rna ba zhes bya ba byung ste /
translated: After them, a king named Karṇa appeared.

original: rgyal po rna ba'i bu ni goo ta ma dang ba ra dhva dza gnyis so //
analyzed: rgyal po rna ba'i bu ni goo ta ma dang ba ra dhva dza gnyis so //
translated: King Karṇa had two sons named Gautama and Bāhradvāja.

original: de gnyis las goo ta ma'i bu ni bu ram shing pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis las goo ta ma'i bu ni bu ram shing pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Of those two, Gautama's son was known as Ikṣvāku.

original: rgyal po bu ram shing pa'i bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud bu ram shing pa'i rgyal po brgyas yang grong khyer gru 'dzin du rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po bu ram shing pa'i bu tsha rgyud dang tsha bo dang yang tsha'i rgyud bu ram shing pa'i rgyal po brgyas yang grong khyer gru 'dzin du rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byas so //
translated: One hundred kings of the Ikṣvāku lineage, including the sons, grandsons, and great-grandsons of King Ikṣvāku, ruled the kingdom in the city of Mathurā.

original: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po 'phags skyes po zhes bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi 'og tu rgyal po 'phags skyes po zhes bya ba byung ste /
translated: After them, a king named Virūḍhaka appeared.

original: rgyal po 'phags skyes po'i bu bzhi la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyal po 'phags skyes po'i bu bzhi la 'di lta ste /
translated: King Virūḍhaka had four sons:

original: bzhin 'bar dang / lag rna dang / glang chen 'dul dang / rkang gdub can rnams te /
analyzed: bzhin 'bar dang / lag rna dang / glang chen 'dul dang / rkang gdub can rnams te /
translated: Jyotiṣka, Karabhañja, Hastaka, and Aṅgada.

original: rkang gdub can gyi bu ni gnas 'jog go //
analyzed: rkang gdub can gyi bu ni gnas 'jog go //
translated: Aṅgada’s son was Vṛjināvāsi.

original: gnas 'jog gi bu ni ba lang gnas so //
analyzed: gnas 'jog gi bu ni ba lang gnas so //
translated: Vṛjināvāsi’s son was Gavāṃpati.

original: ba lang gnas kyi bu ni seng ge 'gram dang / seng ge sgra gnyis so //
analyzed: ba lang gnas kyi bu ni seng ge 'gram dang / seng ge sgra gnyis so //
translated: Gavāṃpati had two sons, Siṃhahanu and Siṃhaghoṣa.

original: seng ge 'gram gyi bu bzhi la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: seng ge 'gram gyi bu bzhi la 'di lta ste /
translated: Siṃhahanu had four sons:

original: zas gtsang dang / zas dkar dang / bre bo zas dang / bdud rtsi zas so //
analyzed: zas gtsang dang / zas dkar dang / bre bo zas dang / bdud rtsi zas so //
translated: Śuddhodana, Śuklodana, Droṇodana, and Amṛtodana.

original: bu mo ni gtsang ma dang / dkar mo dang / bre bo mo dang / bdud rtsi ma rnams so //
analyzed: bu mo ni gtsang ma dang / dkar mo dang / bre bo mo dang / bdud rtsi ma rnams so //
translated: Mādrī,🔽and Amṛtā.

original: zas gtsang gi bu gnyis la bcom ldan 'das dang tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo'o //
analyzed: zas gtsang gi bu gnyis la bcom ldan 'das dang tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo'o //
translated: The two sons of Śuddhodana were the Bhagavat and the venerable Nanda.

original: zas dkar gyi bu gnyis la /
analyzed: zas dkar gyi bu gnyis la /
translated: The two sons of Śuklā were

original: tshe dang ldan pa rgyal ba dang bzang ldan no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rgyal ba dang bzang ldan no //
translated: the venerable Jayamati and Bhadramati.

original: bre bo zas kyi bu gnyis la ming chen dang ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: bre bo zas kyi bu gnyis la ming chen dang ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: The two sons of Mādrī were Mahānāman and Aniruddha.

original: bdud rtsi zas kyi bu gnyis la /
analyzed: bdud rtsi zas kyi bu gnyis la /
translated: The two sons of Amṛtā were

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang lhas byin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang lhas byin no //
translated: the venerable Ānanda and Devadatta.

original: bdud rtsi ma'i bu ni zhi len no //
analyzed: bdud rtsi ma'i bu ni zhi len no //
translated: The son of Amṛtā was Śāriputra.

analyzed: sems can de dag gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i las de'i rnam par smin pas ri chen po rgya che ba dpag tshad mang po dang / dpag tshad brgya phrag mang po dang / dpag tshad stong phrag mang po dang / dpag tshad brgya stong phrag mang po dag yod de ;

analyzed: sems can de dag glem zhing rab tu glem la kun tu rab tu glem mo //

analyzed: de nas sems can de dag der rgyug cing der rab tu rgyug la /

analyzed: gang gi tshe brgya phrag mang po 'dus par gyur pa'i bar du rgyas par bya ste /
